assignments.name: All-AHU Service Day 2025:  Student Reflection Assignment
assignments.description:
Thank you to those who participated in All-AHU Service Day and made a difference in our community! This reflection is designed to help you process your experience and connect it to AHU’s mission and values.

Note: This reflection assignment is intended for students who participated in All-AHU Service Day on November 18, 2025.

You can access the reflection through the QR code below or by using the following link:  All-AHU Service Day Student Reflection.

Following your service day experience, please complete all questions to receive credit for your service-learning graduation requirement. Reflection questions should include thoughtful responses of about 3–5 sentences each.

Due Date: Wednesday, December 4th

We appreciate your commitment to service and learning—thank you for serving with compassion and excellence!

assignments.name: class presentation
assignments.description:
CLASS PRESENTATION – 20 points

 

This grade is shared by the group. Make a presentation ( verbal ) about one of the following infectious disease and submit in writing what you have presented in the class . You may use power points , poster boards or other interesting ways to intrigue your peers . Audience , on the other hand – if you come up with some good “scientific “ questions , maybe  rewarded with extra credits ! so taking notes on the presentation helps . If you miss a presentation of your class mate , 2 points will be deducted from your presentation .

 

Presentation must be at least 25- 30 slides covering the topic in DEPTH. A short 5 min QnA session is encouraged if students want to bag some extra credit for class discussion. Extra credits are awarded by instructors discretion.

I encourage students to show me the presentation a couple of days before so I can make sure that everything is covered.

 

Research paper submission and Construction of your presentation must include the following :

 

  • name of the disease
  • causative agent - its morphology and biochemical activity like aerobe/anaerobe, fermentation , antibiotic sensitivity 
  • pictures of symptoms wherever applicable or a general overview
  • mode of entry
  • establishment and pathogenicity – includes symptoms, organs or body parts involved?
  • DIAGNOSIS : very imp . if any lab tests are done , blood culture , immuno diagnostic tests, microbiological aspects must be in detail
  • prevention and cure – recent drugs in market and mode of action of drugs , vaccine ? 
  • illustrations and any other advance technique you come across .
  • world statistics and US statistics
  • maybe a quiz for your peers or an activity

 

 

 

 

Bacterial infectious diseases

Anthrax

 Botulism 

 Cholera 

Diphtheria 

Gonorrhea

 Leprosy (Hansen's Disease)

 MRSA infection 

Plague

 Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever and Lyme disease (RMSF) 

Syphilis

 Tetanus

 Tuberculosis

Bacterial infections of skin

Dental caries, Gingivitis, periodontal disease

Necrotising faciatis

 

Viral infectious diseases

Dengue fever

Hepatitis C

Chicken pox and shingles

Lassa fever

Poliomyelitis

 Rabies

 West Nile disease

Measels , german measeles and mumps

Cold sores and genital herpes ( HSV I and II)

HIV ( it’s a huge topic ! )

 

 

 Protozoan infectious diseases

Protozoan infection of  GI tract

Malaria

African and american trypanosomiasis

Helminthic infections : text book is a good guide

 Prion infectious diseases

 Bovine spongiform encephalopathy – Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease –mad cow – scrapie - kuru

Fungal infection ( cover at least three in each category)

Fungal infections of skin

Fungal infection of respiratory tract

 

I NEED A ELECTRONIC COPY SUBMITTED IN DROP BOX TO ME BEFORE PRESENTATION – ONE PAPER PER GROUP

assignments.name: Assignment 1 on Chemotherapeutic agents
assignments.description:
WRITING ASSIGNMENT ON CHEMOTHERAPEUTIC AGENT

PLEASE USE SEPARATE BULLETS/ PARAGRAPHS TO ANSWER EACH QS

What are 5 different Classes  of antibiotics and their mode of action. ( 5 points )

How do bacteria get resistant to drugs ( 5 mechanism of resistance ) ( 5 points ) 

 How are human responsible for drug resistance? ( 5 points ) 

What are the answers to following qs ( 5 points )

a. Why is Muller Hinton agar used in experiment described in lab lesson H instead of TSA

b. If Muller Hinton agar is poured very thin , what would be the probable result wrt zone size?

c. If Muller Hinton agar is poured very thick , what would be the probable result wrt zone size?

d. What is the difference in zone of inhibition and zone of clearance?

e.  Why is this method called disk diffusion assay?

 This Four part paper must be written in Four  paragraphs (600 words total) and reference or sites must be cited. If your assignment is 50% or more labelled as plagiarized by turnitin ( except citations ) - it will not be considered for grading and a score of zero will be awarded for the assignment without a second attempt. You may access and use  material from internet BUT put it in your words to write the paper.

assignments.name: Assignment 2 on Food microbiology
assignments.description:
PART 1 (10 points ) 

 

Write / type a paper describing the process of yogurt making .  Mention the temperatures , cultures and procedure. Benefits of consuming yogurt  can be included in your report . 

Plagiarized content above 20 % will automatically receive Grade deduction of 20%

Content with 50% plagiarized material will receive 50% reduced Grade. Anything above 50% will be awarded zero. 

Maximum 500 - 600 words.

Any resources used must be cited.

 

PART 2 ( 10 points )

Also attach 3-4  pictures of your yogurt making steps that you used at home to actually make yogurt with regular milk / almond milk / soy milk ! 

1. Boil half or one cup of milk in the microwave.  whole milk preferred. Make sure it does not boil over :-) ( attach pic) 

2.  cool the milk to body temp.  Just Luke warm and add a spoon of Greek yogurt  ( attach pic of the adding process ) 

3.  let it sit on counter for 8 hrs. and do not refrigerate .

4. Next day dip a spoon, scoop it and check if yogurt was made . (Attach a pic to show me the consistency -pick up the yogurt with spoon and show pic )

courses.name: ENGL102: English Composition II-202324 Spring B
courses.course_code: ENGL102: English Composition II-202324 Spring B

assignments.name: In-Class Activities (1/11)
assignments.description:
In-Class Activities (1/11)

During our class meeting this week, we will be focusing on the following activities:

  • reviewing the syllabus,
  • getting an overview of the class, and
  • getting to know our class community. 

 

You do not need to submit anything here. Just come on time (5:20 pm, Thursday, NB102) and prepared to engage fully with the class activities. If you do this, you will earn all of the available points!

assignments.name: Research Journal - Memo One
assignments.description:
Memo One

This is the beginning of a research journal that you will work on for almost the entire term. So, do not worry right now about grammar, punctuation, or word choice. The goal here is to free write about:

  • the assumptions you have about the research process,
  • any experience you have had with research, and
  • what you hope to gain from this class over the next fourteen weeks. 

 

Because you will return to this composition throughout the term, I am going to track changes that you make along the way. This means that I will require that you compose this document using Microsoft Word. I look forward to reading your initial ideas!

assignments.name: Prewriting: Research Journal - Genre Notes and Questions
assignments.description:
Reading and Genre Awareness

In order to prepare for our work in class, please add the following material to your Research Journal (which we started at the end of class last week):

  • some notes about the features that appear to be included in writing about research,
  • a critique of this genre (things you like and do not like as a reader), and
  • a few questions for our guest in class this week: a chaplain with experience in both healthcare and education.

 

Because you will return to this composition throughout the term, I am going to ask you to label each entry in your Microsoft Word document using an APA style level 1 heading. If you wish to use sub-headings for each entry, you may use APA-style level 2 headings for this purpose. 

 

If you do not use the required approach (adding new memos to an ongoing Word document, labeled with headings), this will be considered to be an incomplete submission (0 points).

assignments.name: Kliztman et al. (2022) and Stavig et al. (2021)
In-Class Activities (1/18)
assignments.description:
In-Class Activities (1/18)

During our class meeting this week, we will be focusing on the following activities:

  • discussing Klizman et al. (2022) and Stavig et al. (2021),
  • understanding the common features of the research genre, and
  • exploring potential research topics for this term (within parameters defined by Dr. Johnson). 

 

You do not need to submit anything here. Just come on time (5:20 pm, Thursday, NB102) and prepared to engage fully with the class activities. If you do this, you will earn all of the available points!

assignments.name: Research Journal - Memo Two
assignments.description:
Memo Two

Now that we have spent time in class discussing the possible research focus for the term, please add a memo to your Research Journal that includes the following:

  • consider what strikes you as an interesting possible area of focus for research this term, and
  • consider what method for gathering data stands out to you as you think of pursuing this area of focus for your own research. 

 

Please label this memo in your Microsoft Word document using an APA style level 1 heading. If you wish to use sub-headings for each entry, you may use APA-style level 2 headings. for this purpose. 

 

If you do not use the required approach (adding new memos to an ongoing Word document, labeled with headings), this will be considered to be an incomplete submission (0 points).

assignments.name: Prewriting: Research Journal - Search Terms and Pilot Study Methods
assignments.description:
Pilot Study

In order to prepare for our work in class, please add the following material to your Research Journal:

  • some ideas for search terms that could be used to find peer-reviewed articles on the research topic you are leaning toward as of now, and
  • some initial methods for digging into research on this topic (describe the approach complete with some potential survey or interview questions). 

 

Because you will return to this composition throughout the term, I am going to ask you to label each entry in your Microsoft Word document using an APA style level 1 heading. If you wish to use sub-headings for each entry, you may use APA-style level 2 headings for this purpose. 

 

If you do not use the required approach (adding new memos to an ongoing Word document, labeled with headings), this will be considered to be an incomplete submission (0 points).

assignments.name: In-Class Activities (1/25)
assignments.description:
In-Class Activities (1/25)

During our class meeting this week, we will be focusing on the following activities:

  • discussing Chapter 3 in our textbook, and
  • designing and carrying out a pilot study related to our class research focus. 

 

You do not need to submit anything here. Just come on time (5:20 pm, Thursday, NB102) and prepared to engage fully with the class activities. If you do this, you will earn all of the available points!

assignments.name: Prewriting: Research Journal - Article Selection
assignments.description:
Article Selection

In order to prepare for our work in class, please submit the following material:

  • three (3) possible peer-reviewed journal articles for the class to review that are related to your research topic (submit in PDF format), and
  • add a rationale to your Research Journal document for each article related to why you believe it is a good fit for the topic and why you believe that perhaps others with related topics should read the articles you selected (length, focus, style, particular angle on the topic, etc.). 

 

Please submit the articles here along with your Research Journal with the new information (above) added and placed under an APA-style heading (as you have done so far in the course).

 

If you do not use the required approach (track changes or suggesting), this will be considered to be an incomplete submission (0 points).

assignments.name: In-Class Activities (2/1)
assignments.description:
In-Class Activities (2/1)

During our class meeting this week, we will be focusing on the following activities:

  • discussing Chapter 2 in the textbook,
  • considering the best way to evaluate, select, and read peer-reviewed journal articles, and
  • understanding how to use source material to create a research space for new inquiry. 

 

You do not need to submit anything here. Just come on time (5:20 pm, Thursday, NB102) and prepared to engage fully with the class activities. If you do this, you will earn all of the available points!

assignments.name: Research Composition - Setup
assignments.description:
Research Composition Setup

We will work in class on setting up the scaffolding upon which your research composition will be built. Follow the in-class instructions for establishing the initial APA-style elements (title page and headings) as well as some draft material (from the work you have done so far in class). 

 

We will complete this work in Google docs assigned to each of you. The links to these docs will always be located on a page that you can connect to from the home page in our course. Even though I have created the links to these documents, I will ask you to submit the link at certain intervals in the class. Submitting the link communicates to me that you are finished with the specific aspects of this assignment related to a particular class meeting.

 

Unless I ask you to do otherwise, you are always welcome to go back to this document and edit, update, and revise as you continue to think about this project. The goal is here is not perfection, but rather for you to explore ideas, using this document as a space for this kind of exploration.

assignments.name: Prewriting: Research Journal - Annotations
assignments.description:
Annotations

In order to prepare for our work in class, please add the following material to your Research Journal document:

  • three (3) annotations (one for each of the articles that you chose to read). Each annotation should include:
    • a full APA reference for the article
    • a short summary of the discussion (or conclusion) section,
    • a mention of any specific calls for future research included in the article (or a note that there are not such calls),
    • a short summary of the methods used by the researchers,
    • some notes about how this article impacts or supports your overall research question,
    • and note about how this article impacts or supports your planned methods for gathering primary data.

 

Please add these annotations on their own, dedicated pages at the end of your Research Journal. There is a sample annotation provided along with a helpful link to an APA-style reference example in the Week 5 module. Please review these resources to guide your work. 

 

If you do not use the required approach (added to the end of your document), this will be considered to be an incomplete submission (0 points).

assignments.name: In-Class Activities (2/8)
assignments.description:
In-Class Activities (2/8)

During our class meeting this week, we will be focusing on the following activities:

  • synthesizing source material,
  • APA, and
  • using source material to create a research space. 

 

You do not need to submit anything here. Just come on time (5:20 pm, Thursday, NB102) and prepared to engage fully with the class activities. If you do this, you will earn all of the available points!

assignments.name: Research Journal - Annotation Revision
assignments.description:
Annotations

Now that we have spent time in class working with the source material that you read and annotated, submit your updated annotations in your Research Journal here.

assignments.name: Prewriting: Research Journal - Annotation
assignments.description:
Annotation

In order to prepare for our work in class, please add the following material to your Research Journal document:

  • one (1) annotation (for one additional article that you chose to read with the guidance of the class community). The annotation should include:
      • a full APA reference for the article
      • a short summary of the discussion (or conclusion) section,
      • a mention of any specific calls for future research included in the article (or a note that there are not such calls),
      • a short summary of the methods used by the researchers,
      • some notes about how this article impacts or supports your overall research question,
      • and note about how this article impacts or supports your planned methods for gathering primary data.

Please add these annotations on their own, dedicated pages at the end of your Research Journal. There is a sample annotation provided along with a helpful link to an APA-style reference example in the Week 5 module. Please review these resources to guide your work.

assignments.name: In-Class Activities (2/15)
assignments.description:
In-Class Activities (2/15)

During our class meeting this week, we will be focusing on the following activities:

  • continuing to master APA-style formatting,
  • paraphrasing source material, and
  • creating an effective synthesis of themes from source material.

 

You do not need to submit anything here. Just come on time (5:20 pm, Thursday, NB102) and prepared to engage fully with the class activities. If you do this, you will earn all of the available points!

assignments.name: IMRaD Research Composition - Source Synthesis & Methods Protocol Draft
assignments.description:
Source Synthesis

Now we are going to continue to build the IMRaD (Introduction, Methods, Results and Discussion) genre that will summarize our primary research work this term. As such, please submit your Research Composition with ready-to-review drafts of the following:

  • an introductory paragraph that describes your research topic, 
  • a synthesis of the sources that you read that establish the research space that will be addressed when you carry out your plans to gather primary data, and
  • a protocol (in the appendices) that will guide the process of gathering your own data. 

 

I will provide feedback in the Google document on these aspects of your composition before we meet for class on February 22.

assignments.name: In-Class Activities (2/22)
assignments.description:
In-Class Activities (2/22)

During our class meeting this week, we will be focusing on the following activities:

  • finalizing plans to gather primary data, and
  • submitting a research proposal that reflects these plans.

 

You do not need to submit anything here. Just come on time (5:20 pm, Thursday, NB102) and prepared to engage fully with the class activities. If you do this, you will earn all of the available points!

assignments.name: IMRaD Research Composition - Research Proposal
assignments.description:
Research Proposal

We are continuing to build the IMRaD (Introduction, Methods, Results and Discussion) genre that will summarize our primary research work this term. At this stage of the process, you will complete the sections of the Research Composition that summarize your plans to gather primary data. This is sometimes referred to as a research proposal. 

 

So, during class this evening, we will complete a working draft of the following sections of your Research Composition (in the Google doc you have been building so far this term):

  • a short introduction to your topic,
  • a synthesis of the four sources you selected,
  • a C.A.R.S. move (paragraph to connect your sources to your research question,
  • your research question(s),
  • description of the methods you will use to gather data, and
  • a specific list of questions (survey, interview, etc.) you will use in this process. 

 

I will give you feedback over Spring break on this work, with the goal to begin gathering data (putting your plans into action) when we return from break.

assignments.name: Research Journal - Memo Four
assignments.description:
Reflecting

Now that we have arrived at the first half of the class, please add the following material to your Research Journal:

  • consider how the experience of completing this research process so far is similar to, or different from, what you expected in your first research journal entry, and
  • reflect a little bit on your own experience with the process so far. What have you learned about yourself as a researcher? 

 

Please submit your Research Journal with the new information (above) added and placed under an APA-style heading (as you have done so far in the course).

assignments.name: Prewriting: Initial Primary Data
assignments.description:
Initial Primary Data

In order to prepare for our work in class, please post the primary data that you have collected so far to this discussion board. Please post your data (recording or recording transcripts, interview notes, PDFs of survey data, pre/post results, notes, etc.) as a reply to your research group below. 

 

Your data should be in a format that your research group can work with you to analyze. For interviews, you can include notes about interviews completed at this point.

assignments.name: In-Class Activities (3/7)
assignments.description:
In-Class Activities (3/7)

During our class meeting this week, we will be focusing on the following activities:

  • reviewing practice data sets in groups, and
  • beginning to analyze this data in order to begin to understand some practical approaches to data analysis.

 

You do not need to submit anything here. Just come on time (5:20 pm, Thursday, NB102) and prepared to engage fully with the class activities. If you do this, you will earn all of the available points!

assignments.name: Prewriting: Additional Primary Data
assignments.description:
Additional Primary Data

In order to prepare for our work in class, please post the additional primary data that you collected based on last week's class discussion. In order to keep all of the data in one place please return to last week's discussion board and reply to your original post there with additional data (recording transcripts, PDFs of survey data, pre/post results, notes, etc.). 

 

In your post, please include a few notes about any themes that you see emerging in your data or any interesting responses that have caught your attention at this point.

assignments.name: In-Class Activities (3/14)
assignments.description:
In-Class Activities (3/14)

During our class meeting this week, we will be focusing on the following activities:

  • reviewing the additional primary data in groups, 
  • analyzing this data in order to illuminate themes and possible responses to your research questions, and
  • starting to build your "Results" section in your Research Composition.

 

You do not need to submit anything here. Just come on time (5:20 pm, Thursday, NB102) and prepared to engage fully with the class activities. If you do this, you will earn all of the available points!

assignments.name: In-Class Activities (3/21)
assignments.description:
In-Class Activities (3/21)

During our class meeting this week, we will be focusing on the following activities:

  • discussing Downs's article in Writing about Writing, 
  • considering the rhetoric of research,
  • critiquing the standard research genre (IMRaD), and

You do not need to submit anything here. Just come on time (5:20 pm, Thursday, NB102) and prepared to engage fully with the class activities. If you do this, you will earn all of the available points!

assignments.name: IMRaD Research Composition - Results Section
assignments.description:
Research Results

We are continuing to build the IMRaD (Introduction, Methods, Results and Discussion) genre that will summarize our primary research work this term. As such, please participate in the addition of the following material to your Research Composition:

  • emerging themes that you see in your primary data, and
  • some specific data points to support or illustrate these themes.

assignments.name: Prewriting: Final Primary Data Submission
assignments.description:
Final, Complete Primary Data

Please submit all transcripts, consent forms, audio files, and/or survey results here.

assignments.name: Cuddy (2012) TED Talk and Loncar (2021) Article
In-Class Activities (3/28)
assignments.description:
In-Class Activities (3/28)

During our class meeting this week, we will be focusing on the following activities:

  • discussing the assigned TED Talk and article,
  • considering research ethics as they apply to your work this term,
  • making in-class presentations of your results, and
  • adding the discussion/conclusion section to your Research Composition.

 

You do not need to submit anything here. Just come on time (5:20 pm, Thursday, NB102) and prepared to engage fully with the class activities. If you do this, you will earn all of the available points!

assignments.name: Prewriting: Results Presentations - Visual Aids
assignments.description:
Results Presentations

At this point in the term, you should have completed data collection, and you should now be prepared to share your results with the class. In class on March 28, you will present your results. Your presentation should include the following elements:

  • your research question,
  • a description of your final primary data set (number of interviews, number of survey responses, general information about the group, such as demographics),
  • three (3) themes that you see in your data (that include information from more than one question and more than one participant)
  • data to support each theme (graphs, quotes, tables...whatever fits your data set), and
  • an initial response to your research question (which can be located in one of your three themes).

 

Please submit here the visual aids that will accompany your presentation. This way, I can have them all pulled up and ready to go as you present. The visual aids can be PowerPoint slides, Google slides, a handout that I will print in advance, or another tool that makes sense to you. As long as you cover the information above in your presentation, the type of visual aid that you choose to accompany what you share is up to you! 

 

Please plan to speak for 7-10 minutes. I will cut each person off at 10 minutes to make sure that everyone has time to share.

assignments.name: In-Class Activities (4/4)
assignments.description:
In-Class Activities (4/4)

During our class meeting this week, we will be focusing on the following activities:

  • considering a genre (other than IMRaD) that might be more effective for conveying your research results and conclusions to a chosen audience,
  • making plans to create this genre,
  • starting to compose a Statement of Goals and Choices for these plans, and
  • finalizing your IMRaD Research Composition.

 

You do not need to submit anything here. Just come on time (5:20 pm, Thursday, NB102) and prepared to engage fully with the class activities. If you do this, you will earn all of the available points!

assignments.name: Research Journal - Memo Five
assignments.description:
Reflecting

Now that we have finished the formal IMRaD Research Composition, please add the following material to your Research Journal:

  • What you are proud of regarding your Research Composition?
  • What aspect of your composition (and/or the research process) required the most revision/rethinking? How did you work through this revision/rethinking process? 
  • What aspects of the research process might be useful to you in future classes, work, or other settings?

 

Please submit your Research Journal with the new information (above) added and placed under an APA-style heading (as you have done so far in the course).

assignments.name: Research Composition - Complete Draft
assignments.description:
Complete Research Drafts

Submit your Research Composition Google doc link. The final composition should have all of the elements listed below. The elements highlighted in green are the ones that we have already written in class! These elements just might need to be updated a little bit. The elements highlighted in blue are the new sections to be added to the document before we meet on 4/4. 

 

Sections Already Completed (or at Least in Working Draft Form)

  • an APA-style title page,
  • an introduction that provides context for your topic (essentially, what brought you to this topic?), 
  • a source synthesis section that provides some background material from all four (4) sources that you read (with APA-style in-text citations),
  • a C.A.R.S. paragraph that connects your sources to your own research plans,
  • a research question (or questions),
  • a methods section that describes what you did to collect your data.
  • an APA-style references page with references for all four of your sources,
  • an appendix with the protocol that you used to gather data.

 

New Sections to be Added Before Class on 4/4

  • results section that begins with an overall description of describes three (3) themes (or patterns) you see in more than one question or participant with specific data (tables, charts, or participant quotes) to support those themes,
  • a discussion section that includes both suggestions for practical applications of what you found (changes you think should be made in the world) and suggestions for future research on this topic,

 

Remember that your results will be composed using the themes and data you presented to the class on 3/28, and your discussion section can use information shared by the class in their feedback on your presentations. 

 

I will be using a complete/incomplete (0/50 or 50/50) approach to grading this assignment. If you receive a 0/50, you can revise and earn 50/50, as long as you complete revisions by the published final day of the term (Friday, April 19).

assignments.name: Prewriting: Research Remix
assignments.description:
Remix and Reasoning

Based on the work you have done with your research group, you will create a genre that translates key ideas from your research this term to a specific, selected audience. Remember that the genre does not have to be static (e.g., it could be a Kahoot quiz or an activity). 

 

What you submit here should be the version of the genre that you will present to your colleagues and a few relevant guests during our final class meeting.

assignments.name: In-Class Activities - Research Remix Presentations
assignments.description:
Remix Presentations

You will make a presentation that includes sharing the remix that you created.

 

You do not need to submit anything here. Just come on time to our designated final exam time (5:20 pm, Thursday, April 18 in NB102) and prepared to make your presentation and to offer feedback to your colleagues as they make their presentations to the class.

assignments.name: Test Analysis Document Assignment
assignments.description:
Analyzing Your Testing Performance

One vital key we have thus far discussed in the course is the important of test-taking skills. Like any other skill, your test-taking can be improved. Part of improving is having a clear understanding/assessment of the issues, creating a plan for improvement, implementing that plan, and reassessing (sounds very similar to the nursing process...).

 

With this assignment, you will complete an analysis of a recent quiz. Due to exam security, we cannot have you complete this assignment on a recent exam that you have taken, but rather we will complete it with a quiz you have taken recently.  To complete this assignment:

  1. In class, we will complete 10-questions on various topics from this term's courses. After each individual question, we will review as a group and complete the analysis form. Your professors will aid in completion, including asking any needed additional thought-provoking questions. 
  2. After class ends, please take your form with you and on the final page, provide a summary of completing the activity, including two of the points from the performance improvement plan that you will include in your studies.
  3. If you are unable to attend class on this day (October 28th), we will provide you will the necessary 10-questions to complete for your assignment. The same due date and time will apply. 
  4. Submit the assignment by the due date of November 4th @ 11:59 pm EST.
    • Review the Test Analysis Document Rubric to assure you get full credit on this assignment.

 

Forms:

PDF of Test-Analysis Form

Word Document of Test-Analysis Form

EXAMPLE of a Completed Test-Analysis Form

Hospital Day #6:  Conclusion

 I. As nursing students, you've gained valuable knowledge in your current courses. How do you envision applying what you've learned to future nursing courses? Share specific examples of how concepts or skills from your current studies will contribute to your success in upcoming courses and, ultimately, in your future nursing practice. (Word count >200)

assignments.name: Hospital Reflection Day #2
assignments.description:

You may upload a word doc, text into the assignment, or submit a video. 

Hospital Day #2: Topic: Safety

  1. What are TWO strategies you implemented today to improve patient safety? 
  2. After reflecting on your clinical day, what are TWO things you could have done differently to improve patient safety?

assignments.name: Hospital Reflection Day #3
assignments.description:
After your UAP experience, please take the time to reflect on your clinical practice thoughtfully. Then, please submit your reflection in the correct clinical drop box in Canvas.

assignments.name: Hospital Reflection Day #4
assignments.description:
After your UAP experience, please take the time to reflect on your clinical practice thoughtfully. Then, please submit your reflection in the correct clinical drop box in Canvas. 

You may upload a word doc, text into the assignment, or submit a video. 

 

 

SNF day #4: Topic: Teamwork

  1. Describe your strengths, limitations, and values as a team member. (list two examples of your strengths, two examples of your limitations, and two examples of your value to the team.)
  2. Write a SMART goal for one of the clients you cared for.

assignments.name: Hospital Reflection Day #5
assignments.description:
After your UAP experience, please take the time to reflect on your clinical practice thoughtfully. Then, please submit your reflection in the correct clinical drop box in Canvas. 

You may upload a word doc, text into the assignment, or submit a video. 

Hospital Day #5: Evidenced-Based Practice (EBP)

  1. Explain the role of evidence in determining the best clinical practice. (>150 words)
  2. Discuss TWO differences noted with the RN Role vs. the UAP/CNA role. Describe the EBP, clinical judgment, or critical thinking required for the RN role in the examples provided.
  3. Write a SMART goal for one of the clients you cared for.

assignments.name: Hospital Reflection Day #1
assignments.description:
Please take time to thoughtfully and thoroughly answer these reflection questions about your Hospital Day #1.

*minimum word count: 200 words*

  1. Now that it's over, what are your first thoughts about your acute care clinical experience?
  2. What were some of your most challenging moments during this clinical day, and what made them so difficult?
  3. What were some of your most powerful learning moments, and what made them so powerful?
  4. Over the next six weeks, what will your greatest strengths be in the clinical setting? Conversely, what are your most significant areas for improvement? 

 

 

Review of how to write a SMART goal for your clients:

 

Examples of expected SMART Goals:

  1. Increase the patient's oxygen saturation level to above 94% while resting within the next 72 hours. 
  2. Reduce the patient's shortness of breath with a respiratory rate between 20-24 per minute within the next 24 hours. 
  3. The client will have no falls during an 8-hour shift. 
  4. The client will report a pain level of 3 or less (current pain goal: 3) during an 8-hour shift. 
  5. The client will ambulate 500 feet twice a day by discharge.

assignments.name: Final Presentation (PowerPoint) - due for ALL groups on Nov. 25.
assignments.description:
Purpose:

Each student in a group will present content that analyzes the professional nursing role related to global health promotion and disease prevention issues for the 21st century. The presentations encompass content that has been explored during the class. Students will use technology for their professional presentations and present the content within an assigned 10-minute block during in-person class on campus. Your professor will assign the topics.

Only one group member (a group representative) should submit the group Final Presentation PowerPoint to this drop box. Submit under your group's topic name.

assignments.description:
Learning Worksheet Submission

Due Date: Sunday, 10/06/24, at 11:30 PM
Late Submissions: Not Accepted (Grade of 0 for late submissions)

Instructions:

  1. Upload Requirement:

    • You are required to upload a minimum of 2 learning worksheets based on the topics covered for Exam 2. Ensure each worksheet is complete and clearly labeled with your name, date, and topic.

  2. Format:

    • Worksheets should be in PDF format and must be legible.
    • Name each file in the following format: YourLastName_TopicName.pdf (e.g., Smith_FluidBalance.pdf).

  3. Submission Deadline:

    • All uploads must be completed by Sunday at noon. No late submissions will be accepted, and failure to submit by the deadline will result in a grade of 0 for this quiz.

  4. Submission Instructions:

    • Upload both worksheets through the designated quiz submission link.
    • Double-check that both files have been successfully uploaded before the deadline. You will not be able to resubmit or upload after the deadline has passed.

  5. Evaluation:

    • Submissions will be reviewed for completeness and adherence to the topics covered. Ensure that each worksheet is accurate, and detailed, and reflects your understanding of the material.

Please reach out before the due date if you have any questions or technical difficulties. Remember, preparation and timely submission are essential!

assignments.name: HESI Practice Quiz
assignments.description:
The quizzes on Elsevier are designed to help you prepare for the HESI exam. Focus on understanding the material; NOT memorizing answers. The goal is to deepen your knowledge of key nursing topics that could be tested.

  1. Log in to Elsevier and start the assigned quiz.
  2. Learn from your mistakes by reviewing each question and rationale, especially the ones you get wrong.
  3. Do not memorize answers—expand your knowledge and understanding.
  4. Track your progress to reinforce learning.
  5. Academic Integrity: Complete the quizzes independently. Cheating or using unauthorized resources undermines your learning and violates academic standards.

assignments.name: HESI Standardized Exam
assignments.description:
The HESI Standardized Exam must be taken on the scheduled date: Friday, 12/06/24, @ 0900 in rooms CC 226/27. 

HESI Specialty Exams Course Policy

The HESI specialty exams per course will be 5% of the course grade.
According to Elsevier HESI Assessment, the recommended minimum score on the specialty exams HESI Exam remains 900.
1. The exam must be taken at the scheduled date and time. See course calendar.
2. The HESI recommended score is 900.
3. The score will be converted into a percentage (i.e. 1000 and above 100%, 950= 95%, 900=90%, 850=85%, 750=75%, etc).
4. Regardless of the score, the student will remediate by using the Evolve-provided remediation packets, case studies, and Evolve Adaptive Quizzing questions (EAQ).
5. The HESI score recorded in the gradebook will be the official score reported from Elsevier and not the student’s computer.
6. Failure to submit the required completed remediation will result in a delay in progression/graduation.

assignments.name: SUNDAY Professor RIVERA Team: Clinical Day 3
assignments.description:
The student will submit a paper of four pages, plus title page and reference page.

 

Guidelines for paper: 

Type in APA format 7th edition, title page plus reference page.

Paper must include three scholarly references (that are used within the paper); article plus others all research articles or text

The TURN IT IN Similarity score needs to be under 25%. Anything over that will not be accepted. References are already excluded

 

Under The Three following headings will be four full pages of writing:

Summary of article – Concise synopsis of article

Personal reaction – was it helpful for use in your group presentation

Application – how you applied the information to your nursing concept project and how you can apply it to future patient care and teaching. Six pages in all is the minimal requirement. Citations necessary.

 

Grading criteria: The group presentation and paper are worth 100 points combined. 50% of grade is presentation other 50% is research paper. See grading rubric.

 

Tuesday clinical group's paperwork are due by Friday 1800 EST

Thursday clinical group's paperwork are due by Sunday 1800 EST

 

 

BSN Concept Project-12.docx

Under The Three following headings will be four full pages of writing:

Summary of article – Concise synopsis of article

Personal reaction – was it helpful for use in your group presentation

Application – how you applied the information to your nursing concept project and how you can apply it to future patient care and teaching. Six pages in all is the minimal requirement. Citations necessary.

 

Grading criteria: The group presentation and paper are worth 100 points combined. 50% of grade is presentation other 50% is research paper. See grading rubric.

assignments.name: Support Group Submission
assignments.description:
General instructions:

A) Attend any support group except an AA or NA meeting. The topic may be on any health-related topic (Diabetes, Alzheimer's, Overeaters Anonymous, NAMI support groups for mental health, Gamers Anonymous, etc.). The student is responsible for arranging/scheduling this experience. Be sure to call the meeting prior to going to make sure they do not object to having students. If the assignment is acceptable you will receive a complete.  This counts toward the completion of your clinical requirements.

Examples:

https://oa.org/find-a-meeting/?type=1

https://www.gamblersanonymous.org/ga/virtual-meetings

https://www.gamingaddictsanonymous.org/online-meetings/

 

Late clinical paperwork will not be accepted. Failure to submit clinical submissions on time will be considered a clinical failure. Two clinical failures will result in a course clinical failure and a course failure.

 

B) Submit a video clip narrative answering the following questions. (Video should be 3: 00 - 5:00 minutes long)

All videos must reflect a professional tone in both appearance (basic ADU dress code guidelines are acceptable) and language.

**This is an individual video. This is not a group assignment.  Each student must make their own video even if attended with another student. 

 

Describe the experience in narrative form:

1. Summarize the experience/activities in which you participated.
(Identify the type of support group you attended)

2. Describe the roles and functions of the team leader members and leadership styles using your textbook.

3. Describe two communication techniques (listed in textbook) you observed the staff use in relating to patients/clients.

4. Identify three maladaptive coping mechanisms shared by group participants or ego defense mechanisms noted using your textbook. 

5. Discuss what you learned and your personal feelings about the experience and how this will inform your future clinical practice. 

 

Late clinical paperwork will not be accepted. Failure to submit clinical submissions on time will be considered a clinical failure. Two clinical failures will result in a course clinical failure and a course failure.

assignments.name: AA Group Assignment Submission
assignments.description:
General instructions:

A) Attend one meeting after the alcohol dependency content in class. Make every effort to attend a “speaker’s” meeting. Your meeting must be of the “open” format. You will receive a complete for the assignment if it is accepted.  

 

Late clinical paperwork will not be accepted. Failure to submit clinical submissions on time will be considered a clinical failure. Two clinical failures will result in a course clinical failure and a course failure.

 

B) Submit a video clip narrative answering the following questions. (Video should be 5:00 - 8:00 minutes in length)

All videos must reflect a professional tone in both appearance (basic ADU dress code guidelines are acceptable) and language.

 

Describe the experience in narrative form discussing the following:

  1. Describe the meeting, AA speaker’s meeting or other format, how long it lasted, etc. What was your impression of the speaker? Remember confidentiality (HIPPA)!
  2. How did the members receive you and how did they receive each other?
  3. Explain the following concepts learned in class: Tolerance, dependency, risk factors for substance abuse, ego defense mechanisms, and maladaptive coping mechanisms commonly associated with alcohol use disorder using your textbook
  4. Identify pertinent nursing screening tools that assess alcohol use and screening tools that assess the risk for withdrawals associated with alcohol use disorder.
  5.  Discuss medication treatments available for alcohol use disorders using your textbook or Lippincott Advisor and the rationale/clinical indication for each medication.
  6.  Discuss important nursing assessment and patient teaching regarding the medications (eg: benzodiazepines, Antabuse, naltrexone, etc.) 
  7. Describe your subjective evaluation; share how you felt about the meeting and how this will influence your patient teaching.

assignments.name: SIM SKILLS LAB Assignment Dropbox
assignments.description:
WELCOME to the NURS240 SIM SKILLS LAB! 

The Course Faculty and Simulation Team have collaborated to create the SIM Skills Lab exercise to enhance your preparation for nursing practice. Every educational activity is designed to offer you practical experience as we strive to equip you with essential skill sets for your future nursing career.

ATTENDANCE and PARTICIPATION GUIDELINES

Attendance for this activity is mandatory as it counts for clinical hours required for the successful completion of this course. Each student is expected to arrive 30 minutes prior to scheduled time per schedule. Student attire must follow AHU's nursing clinical attire policy. Each student must participate in each station. Students are expected to attend both pre-brief and de-briefing for full participation credit. Each assignment is graded as complete or incomplete and count toward clinical hours. If you fail to submit your assignments for this activity by the due date and time as outlined this will count as one clinical incomplete. Two clinical incompletes will result in a clinical failure which may result in course failure. 

DUE DATES and TIMES

Please upload the following assignments 72 hours post scheduled SIM Skills Lab Day.

Students scheduled for SIM Skills Lab on Tuesday please upload your documents by Friday at 1800p EST

Students scheduled for SIM Skills Lab on Thursday please upload your documents by Sunday at 1800p EST

Students scheduled for SIM Skills Lab on Friday please upload your documents by Monday at 1800p EST

ASSIGNMENT BREAKDOWN

VOICES station:

Reflective questions 

SAFETY CHECK station:

Patient belongings checklist

CIWA station:

Completed SBAR 

EPS station:

Completed SBAR

assignments.name: Course Orientation Video & Discussion - START HERE!
assignments.description:
Hello class! Welcome to Mental Health!

We know you have been looking forward to this class! :)  This is the class where you learn more about yourself, family and friends as well as mental health disorders.  Therapeutic communication is at the core of every patient relationship.  Offering hope through God, support through empathy, and safety through knowledge is the basis of the course. You will learn new concepts you have never thought of before.  The coursework is not easy and will require diligence and time management.  You will find the reading assignments in the content outline and study guide - please begin NOW!  It is very important that you get a good start for it is very difficult to catch up once you get behind in reading and assignments. Please be prepared before class for the assigned modules. During class, we will be applying the knowledge from your assigned readings and pre-recorded lectures.  Just follow the calendar and you should not fall behind. Tutoring is available to all students. Make an appointment with us for an individual content review the following week of the exam if you score less than a 77% on an exam.  Please bring your questions to class and share them with us.  We wish you success in this class. We are available to you as resources and are able to meet with you by appointment.

 

Orientation Video and Discussion:

The Orientation Video below will cover different aspects of NURS 240 Mental Health, i.e. Course format, objectives, materials, grading distribution, in person class, and assignments. 

 

Please watch the Orientation video, then reply with all of the following questions answered. Replies to other students are welcome but not required. This assignment is graded as complete/incomplete. 

 

  1. What classroom will classes be taught in?
  2. Where will you physically be for each exam (what room)? 
  3. According to the BSN Student Handbook Supplement, are late assignments accepted?
  4. According to the BSN Student Handbook and Course Syllabus, are late clinical assignments accepted? If you submit a late assignment for clinical (Clinical Paperwork, Support Group, SIMS), how will this affect your progress in this course?
  5. What clinical day and group are you assigned to (day and professor)?
  6. Do you have any course questions? If so, please write your question(s).
  7. What coping skill(s) do you currently utilize to help you cope with the stressors of nursing school?

assignments.name: Cultural Awareness Project
assignments.description:
Assignment | Cultural Awareness Project

Overview

In this course, your faculty will assign you to a group to complete a project focused on culturally competent nursing care. This project will help you understand the impact of cultural beliefs and values on patient care, emphasizing that healthcare providers may treat patients differently based on their race and ethnicity.

Your group will investigate major concerns and issues nurses encounter while providing culturally sensitive care, drawing from observations made during clinical experiences. To support your learning, case scenarios will be provided, illustrating situations that can arise in various healthcare settings. This awareness is crucial for improving nurse-patient relationships and avoiding uncomfortable or dangerous situations in healthcare.

Instructions

In your assigned groups, you will develop a presentation based on the approved project topic. Your PowerPoint (PPT) summary must include the following components:

  1. Visual aids: Incorporate relevant images, graphics, or props to enhance your presentation.
  2. Speaker notes: Provide detailed notes for each slide to guide your discussion and ensure all key points are covered.
  3. Voice overs: Include audio explanations for each slide to create a more engaging experience for your audience.
  4. Team member photos: Submit a full-body photo of each team member, dressed in professional attire.
  5. Bibliographic references: List all references in APA format, ensuring they are from sources published within the last five years.

Your group will record a 10–15 minutes presentation during Week 12, and all members are expected to actively participate.

One designated group member will be responsible for submitting the completed presentation to the assigned group Dropbox prior. Ensure that all components are double-checked for clarity and accuracy, including audio, before submission.

Due

Due by Sunday at 11:59 p.m. local time

Guidelines

  • This assignment is worth 100 points and is graded using the Cultural Awareness Group Project Rubric.
  • Refer to the Cultural Awareness Project Description outlining the instructions and guidelines.
  • This assignment counts toward 5% of your overall grade.
  • Your guidance sheets must be submitted as a Microsoft Word document or PDF file.
  • Submit your assignment in Canvas. For additional help, see How Do I Upload a File as an Assignment Submission in Canvas?

NURS240 Mental Health Nursing HESI Remediation Dropbox
assignments.description:
The following remediation MUST be completed and submitted in Summer 2025 through a Dropbox located in NURS 330 Nursing of Childbearing Family. Due date: May 23, 2025, 5:00 PM

  • Evolve Remediation Packets
    1. Based on your Psychology/Mental Health NGN HESI Report, Evolve will create remediation packets per topics in low performing content.
    2. Students are required to use these packets for content remediation, in addition to the utilization of other recommended sources (Lippincott, Evolve).
  • Evolve Assigned Case Study Scenarios
    1. Students must also complete the assigned Evolve Case Studies created based on your low performing content areas.
    2. A score of 80% minimum per Case Study is required to count for completion.
  • Question Completion
    1. To maintain competency in any low performing content, students will be required to complete and submit 75 mental health content questions (no required score needed for completion). Questions must be completed after the Psychology/Mental Health NGN HESI Exam is complete and before the assigned due date. All question rationales must be reviewed for the questions to count.
    2. Questions must be used only from the NURS 240 Mental Health Nursing’s course PrepU book resource.

No other question sources will be accepted.

  1. Submit a screenshot of your score report for each quiz completed in the Dropbox in NURS 330 Nursing of Childbearing Family.
  • Completed RN Psychology/Mental Health NGN HESI Exam Agreement Form
  • Submit your completed HESI EXAM Agreement Form into the Dropbox in NURS 330 Nursing of Childbearing Family.
  • Failure to complete and/or submit the required remediation listed above will result in a grade of zero on the NURS 330 Nursing of Childbearing Family Failure to submit the required remediation may result in the inability to take the Mid-HESI exam in the third trimester.

**Be sure to select "expand arrow" to show all required remediation packets. Also, be sure to select the "complete/finish" button at the bottom of each packet to mark as complete.** When course faculty review and packets are noted as not completed, remediation will be graded as zero. 

The faculty will check the reports in the Evolve Accounts to verify that you have completed the review and reading of all of the Assigned Packets and successfully completed the Assigned Case studies scoring 80% or higher on each case study.

 

Submit into the Dropbox for credit and grade in NURS 330 Nursing of Childbearing Family by the Due date: May 23, 2025, 5:00 PM

  1. This completed and signed NURS 240 Mental Health Nursing RN Psychology/Mental Health NGN HESI Exam Agreement Form.
  2. Remediation Questions Verification form – screenshot from Course Point

(This is a screenshot from the How am I doing – Quiz History in Course Point – only acceptable screenshot view. Shows the number of questions, date completed, and scores)

assignments.name: OB Clinical Orientation: Ticket to Enter Pre-work
assignments.description:
Required Reading & Sherpath Osmosis/Clinical Skills Videos

Sherpath Osmosis video when complete will be graded via Canvas. They are marked as pass/fail

The following chapters must be read prior to Tuesday, May 6, 2024 at 8:00 am  The below chapters do not need to be read in their entirety, as they will be covered in later content. Chapters, 2, 3, 6, and 7 are part of module 1 assigned reading. 

  • Chapter 2 “Social, Cultural, and Ethical Issues” (Focus on Social and Cultural, but the entire chapter should be read for module 1 reading)
  • Chapter 3 “Reproductive Anatomy and Physiology” (Read only normal anatomy for male/female and the normal function of each reproductive system)
  • Chapter 6 “ Adaptations to Pregnancy” (Briefly read of body system changes during pregnancy)
  • Chapter 7 “ Antepartum Assessment, Care, and Education” (Read only common discomforts of pregnancy, perinatal education)
  • Chapter 13 “ Pain Management During Childbirth” (Read only non-pharmacological vs pharmacological pain management)
  • Chapter 17 “Postpartum Adaptation and Nursing Care” (Read only postpartum assessment)
  • Table 15.4 on page 341

The following videos count for clinical hours and responsibilities.

Students must review the required videos by Monday, May  5, 2024  at 11:59pm (EST).

Required videos:

  • Early Care of the Newborn (Sherpath Osomosis video)
  • Assessment of the Newborn (Sherpath Osmosis video)
  • Maximizing Comfort for the Laboring Woman – Pharmacologic Management (Sherpath Osmosis Video)
  • Maximizing Comfort for the Laboring Woman – Nursing Care (Sherpath Osmosis video)
  • Infant Feeding (Sherpath Osmosis)
  • Nursing Care During and After Birth (Sherpath Osmosis)
  • Vaginal Birth After Cesarean Delivery (Clinical Skills: Maternal Newborn Collection, 1st Edition)
  • Cesarean Delivery: Emergency (Clinical Skills: Maternal Newborn Collection, 1st Edition)
  • Performing Sterile Gloving (Clinical Skills: Skills for Nursing Collection, 1st edition)
  • Urinary Catheter: Indwelling (Foley) Catheter Insertion (Clinical Skills: Skills for Nursing Collection, 1st edition)
  • Removing an Indwelling (Foley) Urinary Catheter (Clinical Skills: Skills for Nursing Collection, 1st edition)

assignments.name: Final Signed Clinical Evaluation (all pages and with signature)
Post-Simulation Assignment
assignments.description:
As a finalization of your simulation, you are required to review your simulation video and answer the following questions. This aspect of simulation is very important as it is a crucial moment in the learning experience during simulation. Answer the following questions [in a Word Document] and submit in the dropbox by Tuesday, August 5th at 11:59pm. An announcement was made with the instructions to log into CA Learning Space to view your video. This is a reflection assignment, therefore it must be completed after watching the simulation video.(See announcement with information about accessing your simulation video via CAE)

  • Overall reflection after watching your video - what is different from your initial take-away (what you thought you did well or not well) to now watching your video? 
  • What assessment data alerted you to the potential for a postpartum hemorrhage?
  • Which nursing interventions did you perform to manage postpartum hemorrhage?
  • Which medications did you administer during your simulation?
  • Teamwork is essential in situations where a patient’s condition is critical. Discuss how you divided the tasks with your peer. How well did you divide tasks? 
  • Postpartum hemorrhage occurs when you may be alone - what would you have done if you did not have a partner or if your team could not help you right away?
  • Calling the physician and taking verbal orders is something that can be challenging for many new nurses. Reflect on how that experience made you feel.
  • Is there anything you feel you did very well? Is there anything you wish you had done differently?

assignments.name: Quiz 1: Health Assessment and Foundations of Nursing Concepts - Requires Respondus LockDown Browser + Webcam
HESI Exam Prep: Health Assessment
assignments.description:
1. In preparation for each HESI exam in this course, this assignment will help to reinforce concepts that you missed in your previous HESI exam or other exams related to the test.
  2. Each HESI Exam Prep assignment is worth 50 points.
  3. You will need to go back to your previous HESI exam result and pick concepts that you want to do the NCLEX-RN practice questions. You can use different resources such as CoursePoint+ or HESI 7th edition online resources.
  4. You will need to upload your HESI Health Assessment Report (previous semester).
  5. You will need to complete 50 NCLEX-RN practice questions and review each rationale.
  6. You will need to upload the screenshot of completion capturing the number of questions you did and the date you did the activity.
  7. HESI Exam Prep assignment cannot be made up.
  8. This assignment is due 15 minutes before your HESI Exam.

assignments.name: Educational Flyer First Submission
assignments.description:
NURS 340 Educational Flyer

You will individually create an educational flyer (one page handout) on a pediatric disease process. This assignment will be submitted in intervals as outlined in the course calendar. Feedback will be given with the first submission so you may make corrections based upon feedback received.

Key Points:

  • You are creating this flyer to discuss pathophysiology, symptoms, and treatment for the disease process with parents. 
  • Go to Sherpath AI and ask: What information should be included in an Educational Flier for patients on (put topic here), include pathophysiology, symptoms and treatments. Then review the content for completeness, accuracy and any contraindications. Copy this information on a “word document” and submit as submission 1.
  • Then after approval, you can create the flyer. Make sure to include resources in APA format, and appropriate images. Follow the rubric closely.

The project will be submitted in intervals as outlined in the course calendar. Feedback will be given with the first submission so groups may make corrections based upon feedback received.

  • Submission 1: Approval of topic and content
  • Final Educational Flyer Submission

Some Sample Topics  

·       RSV / BRONCHIOLITIS

·       ASTHMA

·       LEUKEMIA

·       GLOMERULO-

·       NEPHRITIS

·       OTITIS MEDIA

·       STREP THROAT

·       CHICKEN POX

·       CROHN’S

·       HEAD LICE

·       PINK EYE

 

Educational Flyer Rubric

 

20 points

15 points

0 points

AI tool utilized and turned in on time.

(FIRST SUBMISSION)

AI documentation was submitted by the due date.

 

AI Documentation was not submitted on time.

Easily understood

Understandable by lay person with 8th grade education. Pediatric appropriate images included.

Well thought out with important facts presented

Flyer informative and thought out.

Important information not included in topic.

Proper Grammar, punctuation, and spelling.

Flyer with 0-2 grammar, punctuation, or spelling issues

Flyer with 3-4 grammar, punctuation, or spelling issues

Flyer with >4 grammar, punctuation, or spelling issues.

Professional reference no older than 5 years, in proper APA format.

 

Professional reference in proper APA

Professional reference not in APA or older than 5 years

No reference included

TOTAL POINTS

assignments.name: Week 2 Class Discussion Post for Grading
assignments.description:
Week 2: Class Discussion 

Overview

This week, you will participate in class discussions based on your last name. Each group has a different discussion prompt. Please read your assigned chapter(s) and post your response in the discussion board. Remember to use your textbook and/or a professional reference (not a textbook alone) to support your response in 7th ed. APA format (See Rubric for full credit)

Instructions by Last Name

Last Name A–E

Chapter 1: Forces Driving the Use of Informatics in Healthcare

    • Investigate ONE force driving the move toward greater use of informatics (see textbook pp. 8–11)
    • Share with your peers the impact of this driving force on:
      1. Nursing practice
      2. Patient outcomes
      3. The healthcare system (when informatics is implemented effectively)

** Important: Informatics is about information management, not just computers. We now manage large amounts of client data that can be used to improve patient care, nursing practice, and healthcare systems.

Last Name F–M

Chapter 1: Computer is Not the Focus

    • Support the statement: “The computer is a tool of informatics, but not the focus.”
    • Discuss how informatics as information management (not just technology) allows us to handle large amounts of client data to improve healthcare quality and outcomes.

Last Name N–Z

Chapter 4: Social Media and Professionalism
After reading NCSBN: Nurse’s Guide to Social Media and Chapter 4, take on the role of the “Social Media Police.” Choose one option below:

    1. Summarize the NCSBN Guidelines for an Intro to Nursing class. Include at least three key pieces of information.
    2. Review a social media feed to identify a HIPAA or professionalism violation. Explain why it is a violation and describe possible consequences.
    3. Discuss how social media posts impact the profession of nursing (positively or negatively).

*** *** Remember: You must post your response in two places —Week 2 Class Discussion Post for Grading and Week 2 Class Discussion Post for Sharing!!!

assignments.name: Week 4: VIDEO Discussion Post
assignments.description:
Pick ONE topic and post your VIDEO response. Typed responses will NOT receive credit.

Please record in Canvas: How to record a video in Canvas. (How to video posted under Week 4 learning resources)

reply-->-->-->pick record -->-->-->

If you notice your video is stuck loading, don’t re-record just yet. Before doing that, try closing the video screen first, as the video is likely already saved in your files. To upload it, follow the recording steps again, but this time, click on 'User Media' and select the video you previously recorded.

Pick ONE topic and post your VIDEO response. Typed responses will NOT receive credit. Videos should be between 2-3 minutes, so you must think about your answers before making your video.

You do NOT have to reply to your peers videos, but you can if you want! 🎉🎉👏👏

 

Pick ONE topic and post your VIDEO response. 

1. Healthcare consumers: With the rise of "internet healthcare," healthcare providers are increasingly acting as advisors, while patients are taking on the role of informed consumers or clients. 

      1. Describe a current trend in the healthcare environment related to "internet healthcare" (e.g., wearable health tech, online symptom checkers).
      2. How has this trend shifted the dynamic between healthcare providers and patients?
      3. Support your response with evidence from current literature or reputable sources.

2. EHR & interoperability: Healthcare interoperability plays a critical role in improving patient outcomes by enabling the seamless exchange of health information across different systems.

      1.   In your own words, define healthcare interoperability and explain why it is important for patient care.
      2. Provide two specific examples of how interoperability between Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems, such as those used at AdventHealth and Orlando Health, can improve patient outcomes. 

3. Personal health records (PHR): Personal Health Records (PHRs) empower patients to take an active role in managing their health information by allowing them to access, update, and share their medical data.

    1. What are the key differences between Personal Health Records (PHRs) and Electronic Health Records (EHRs), and
    2. How can PHRs enhance patient engagement and care coordination?
    3. Provide 2 examples of how PHRs could improve patient outcomes, particularly in managing chronic conditions or during emergency situations. 

Your post is due by Sunday @ 2359 EST. 

 

Examples of Verbal Citing, Introduction, and Closing Remarks

Verbal Citing Example:

  • “According to the Mayo Clinic in 2023, …”

  • “A study published in the Journal of Nursing Informatics in 2025 found that …”

  • “A 2023 report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention highlights that..."

Introduction Example:

  • “Hello, my name is Sarah Johnson, and today I’ll be discussing how Electronic Health Records improve patient safety and streamline nursing workflows.”

Closing Remark Example:

  • “In conclusion, Electronic Health Records play a vital role in improving healthcare quality and reducing errors. Thank you for watching my presentation.”

Please follow the rubric closely to receive full credit. Course faculty strictly adheres to the rubric to ensure fairness and transparency in grading.

assignments.name: (week 13) Hospital Compare Quiz
assignments.description:
Do you use Yelp or TripAdvisor? How often do you look at reviews before you do something? In the next few years, looking up the statistics of hospital outcomes will be standard practice. 

Hospital Compare has information about the quality of care at over 4,000 Medicare-certified hospitals across the country, including over 130 Veterans Administration (VA) medical centers. You can use Hospital Compare to find hospitals and compare the quality of their care.

The information on Hospital Compare:

  • Helps you make decisions about where you get your healthcare
  • Encourages hospitals to improve the quality of care they provide 

Directions:

1. https://www.medicare.gov/care-compare/

 This website will need to be open for you to navigate and answer the quiz questions. 

2. Zip code: 32803, Provider type: Hospital --> search  (leave the name of facility empty)

4. Compare: 

  • AdventHealth Orlando  
  • Orlando Health 

The title of each question matches the tabs on the website. 

 

*there is no word count requirement on the essay questions**

assignments.name: (week 5) Website Evaluation Assignment
assignments.description:
Website Evaluation Assignment

  1. Read Chapter 9, pages 153–155: Discovering and Evaluating Health Information on the Internet.

  2. Create a patient education flyer that identifies the five categories to use when examining healthcare websites. The purpose of the flyer is to educate users on how to verify the authenticity and reliability of online health information.

    • Currency

    • Relevance

    • Authority

    • Accuracy

    • Purpose/Point of View

  3. Your flyer may be simple or creative, but it must clearly explain how to evaluate a healthcare website (do not evaluate one specific site).

  4. Educate one person (not a classmate or family member) using your flyer. You may teach in person or virtually (e.g., Zoom).

  5. Take a selfie of yourself with the person you instructed.

    • Make sure you are in the picture.

    • If the person does not want their face shown, take the picture from the back.

    • Do NOT take a picture of a patient.

  6. Submit both your flyer and your selfie. (Use JPG or PNG format only—HEIC files cannot be opened in Canvas).

  7. Ensure your flyer meets all rubric requirements before submission.

assignments.name: (week 6) Patient Education Readability
assignments.description:
You are planning to make an educational flyer for the patient in the hospital. Pick a disease process you are currently learning about in Peds or Adult Health 2 in a word document and write the information you would place in a brochure (do not make a brochure).

Include the following information:

  • Overview of the pathophysiology

  • Signs and symptoms

  • Cause (if applicable)

  • How the disease is diagnosed

  • Treatment options

Writing Guidelines:

  • The content must be written at an 8th-grade reading level (8–8.9).

  • Use the article Assessing and Addressing Health Literacy (from your assigned readings) and your textbook for guidance.

Readability Check:

  1. Once you have your information written, copy and paste your written text into https://readable.com/

  2. Click “Try it free” to access the free version. (See the announcement video for guidance.)

  3. Run a readability test using “Test Your Readability.”

  4. Close the pop-up box asking to purchase the PRO version.

    • If you run out of free edits, take a screenshot of the message showing that you cannot continue.

    • Do not pay or enter credit card information for this assignment.

  5. Adjust your text based on the site’s recommendations until the Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level reads between 8.0–8.9.

Submission Requirements:

  • Submit a screenshot showing your Flesch-Kincaid grade level between 8.0–8.9.

  • Include part of your Word document text in the screenshot to verify that the test was run on your submission (see the Submission example below).

  • If you are unable to complete the task due to free trial limits, please submit a screenshot of the lockout message as proof.

Grading:

  • This assignment is all-or-nothing. Full credit is awarded only if the submission shows a Flesch-Kincaid grade level between 8.0–8.9 (or a valid screenshot of lockout).

*** This website is quickly overwhelmed. If you to the last minute and the site is down, you will not receive credit. I promise that the website will crash on Sunday night when you all complete this assignment.

 

Submission example
