It's crucial to understand that not using standardized terminology can have a significant negative impact on patient care and outcomes. Consistency in language ensures clear communication among healthcare professionals, which is essential for accurate diagnosis, treatment, and overall patient well-being.

assignments.name: (Week 9) Group project: Workflow Improvement Statistics
assignments.description:
Assignment Guidelines

  1. Brief description of the informatics intervention (CPOE, CDS/CDSS, BCMA, or Automated Medication Dispensing System)

    • Provide a clear, concise overview (maximum 3 sentences).

  2. Statistics: Include one statistic per bullet point addressing the following areas:

    • Impact on client safety outcomes (goal: improve safety)

    • Impact on healthcare team workflow (focus on nursing when possible; goal: standardize and simplify workflows)

    • Impact on healthcare costs (goal: reduce overall costs)

*Only ONE person from the group needs to post. You do NOT need to reply to the other team's post**

 

Rubric:

Topic Excellent  Average  Poor
Description of Informatics Intervention

6 points

Clear, concise, and accurate description of the chosen/assigned intervention (CPOE, CDS/CDSS, BCMA, or Automated Medication Dispensing System). Stays within 3 sentences.

 

3 points

The description is mostly clear and accurate, but it is missing some minor details.

The description is 3-4 sentences. 

 

 

 

0 points 

Description is unclear, inaccurate, or exceeds 4 sentences.

 

 

 

 

 
Impact on Client Safety Outcomes

6 points 

a. Provides one statistic or statement describing the impact of the informatics technology on client safety outcomes.


b. Supported by a credible healthcare website or research article within the past 5 years.

3 points 

a. Provides one statistic or statement not describing the impact on client safety outcomes.


b. OR provides relevant info but without an appropriate reference.

 

0 points

Missing statistic, lacks explanation, or no citation provided.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 
Impact on Healthcare Team Workflow

6 points

a. Provides one statistic or statement describing the impact of the informatics technology on healthcare workflow.


b. Supported by a credible healthcare website or research article within the past 5 years.

3 points 

Provides a statistic with some relevance; explanation may lack clarity or connection to workflow. 

 The statistic or statement was not supported by a credible healthcare website or research article within the past 5 years. 

 

 

 

0 points

Missing statistic, lacks explanation, or no citation provided.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 
Impact on Cost of Healthcare

6 points 

a. Provides one statistic or statement describing the impact of the informatics technology on the cost of healthcare.


b. Supported by a credible healthcare website or research article within the past 5 years.

3 points 

Provide one statistic or statement not describing the impact the informatics technology on the cost of healthcare. 

Provide one statistic or statement describing the impact of informatics technology on healthcare costs, but not supported by a credible healthcare website or research article within the past 5 years. 

0 points

Missing statistic, lacks explanation, or no citation provided.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 
APA Formatting & References

6 Points

All in-text citations and references are accurate, complete, and follow APA guidelines.

3 points

Minor APA errors in citations or references (3-6 APA errors).

 

0 points

Multiple errors or missing citations/references (>7 APA errors).

 
Total Points 

30 points 

 

 

 

Assignment example:

  1. RFID: Radio frequency identification is GPS in the hospital, using radio waves to transfer data. In the hospital setting, RFID can capture data automatically without human intervention. Some common uses of RFID in the hospital include: 
    • “Inventory control
    • Equipment tracking
    • Out-of-bed detection and fall detection
    • Personnel tracking
    • Ensuring that patients receive the correct medications and medical devices
    • Preventing the distribution of counterfeit drugs and medical devices
    • Monitoring patients
    • Providing data for electronic medical records systems” (Radiofrequency identification, 2018, para. 2).
  1. Impact on:
  • Impact on client safety outcomes: RFID technology has 100% accuracy in tracking wandering patients with elopement risk, particularly with patients who have Alzheimer’s and dementia (Paaske et al., 2017).
  • Impact on workflow: RFID tags can reduce misidentification issues during many nursing workflows, like passing medications and administering blood. When the workflow is done correctly, there are no critical errors (Paaske et al., 2017).
  • Impact on healthcare costs: The return on investment (ROI) of purchasing RFID has an approximate payback period of four years (Haddara & Staaby, 2018). RFIDs are expensive, but the upfront cost is worth the cost-saving benefits over a period of time.

 

                                                                               References

Haddara, M., & Staaby, A. (2018). RFID applications and adoptions in healthcare: A review on patient safety. Procedia Computer Science, 138, 80–88. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.procs.2018.10.012

Paaske, S., Bauer, A., Moser, T., & Seckman, C. (2017). The benefits and barriers to RFID technology in healthcare: OJNI. On-Line Journal of Nursing Informatics, 21(2), 1-2. Retrieved from https://resource.ahu.edu/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/docview/1984766816?accountid=35793   (**Please use DOI if it is available-see APA resources for the proper referencing format for DOI**)

US Food and Drug Administration (FDA). (2018). Radiofrequency identification. Retrieved from  https://www.fda.gov/radiation-emitting-products/electromagnetic-compatibility-emc/radio-frequency-identification-rfid#information

As always, read the question entirely to assure that you are answering what the question is asking you!

assignments.name: Weight-Based Quiz #1
assignments.description:
This quiz involves calculating doses of medications that are weight-based.  There are 10 questions per quiz.  Questions may simply just ask you for the amount you are given (in milligrams, micrograms, etc.) or may ask you do complete your basic dosage calculation math to determine how much (tablets, mL, etc.) that you are giving the patient.

 

As always, remember to read your question thoroughly.

assignments.name: Weight-Based Quiz #2
assignments.description:
This quiz involves calculating doses of medications that are weight-based.  There are 10 questions per quiz.  Questions may simply just ask you for the amount you are given (in milligrams, micrograms, etc.) or may ask you do complete your basic dosage calculation math to determine how much (tablets, mL, etc.) that you are giving the patient.

 

As always, remember to read your question thoroughly.

assignments.name: Rate of Infusion Quiz #1
assignments.description:
These questions are very basic rate questions!  They require you to utilize your basic rate formulas to figure out the rate of infusion using an electronic infusion pump.  

 

As always, please read the question thoroughly before answering!

assignments.name: Rate of Infusion Quiz #2
assignments.description: More questions of just basic rate of infusion!  In further quizzes, you will also see questions that ask for completion time of an infusion, or the time it will take for the infusion to complete in hours!

assignments.name: Rate of Infusion Quiz #3
assignments.description:
This quiz has some basic rate of infusion questions, but also adds in questions that ask for what time the infusion will end, or the time in hours or minutes that the infusion will end!

 

Remember to read the questions thoroughly!

assignments.name: Drop Factor Quiz #1
assignments.description:
These questions focus on your drop factor formulas!  Remember, all answers will be rounded to the nearest whole number, as it is impossible to calculate 0.4 of a drop or whatnot!

 

Always read the question thoroughly!

assignments.name: Drop Factor Quiz #2
assignments.description: These are your basic drop factor problems!  Use the formulas that you have been taught.

assignments.name: 2nd/3rd Term Comprehensive Quiz #1
assignments.description:
This quiz includes questions from the following categories:

  • Basic Math (pills, oral liquids, IV medications)
  • Intake and Output
  • Rate of Infusion (mL/hr)
  • Drop Factor (gtt/min)
  • Weight-Based (mg/kg)

 

Much like your regular exams or even your beginning of the term dosage calculation exam, the combination of types of problems will not be consistent.  One comprehensive exam may have 5 basic math problems and a combination or others...or one may be 9 rate questions with one weight-based!  That is the challenging part of dosage calculation; you can only expect so much!  It is important to practice all types of problems, especially if you find you are weak in one area over another!

assignments.name: 3rd Term Comprehensive Quiz #1
assignments.description:
You have actively learned more than half of the math in your nursing program at this point!

The questions in this quiz (and all of the comprehensive quiz) will be of a variety, without a rhyme or reason.  One quiz may be all basic dosage with one rate question, or one quiz could be more weight-based heavy with a few drop factor!  Its a healthy mix.

Each quiz is 10 questions and are timed for 20 minutes to simulate your dosage calculation exams at the beginning of the term!  

 

As always... read all questions thoroughly prior to answering!

This quiz includes a mix of dosage calculation (basic math, conversions, rate, drop factor, reconstitution, weight-based, and pediatric) and will simulate your dosage calculation exam taken the first week of class.  The problems may be worded differently, but the information is always the same!  It is timed for 50 minutes to challenge you to the same time frame your real dosage exam is!   Practice does make perfect (or as close as we can be!).

assignments.name: First Submission HESI Remediation Dosage Quiz - 20 Questions
assignments.description:
The following quiz is for students completing their required portion of Mid HESI Remediation.  The quiz contains 20-questions and contains math that students are required to master prior to entering AH2 (basic math problems with/without conversions, mL/hr or rate problems, drop factor problems, weight-based problems, and reconstitution).  

As a reminder, you are required to score 100 % on this quiz. You may take as many times as needed; be sure to take a screenshot after completion to include in your required submission of remediation.

 

Follow all rounding instructions per problem. If none are given, there is no rounding necessary.

assignments.name: Third Submission HESI Remediation Dosage Quiz - 40 Questions
assignments.description:
The following quiz is for students completing their required portion of Mid HESI Remediation.  The quiz contains 40-questions and contains math that students are required to master by the end of AH3 (basic math problems with/without conversions, mL/hr or rate problems, drop factor problems, weight-based problems, pediatric weight-based problems, reconstitution, and critical-care/continuously infused medication rate).  

As a reminder, you are required to score 100 % on this quiz. You may take as many times as needed; be sure to take a screenshot after completion to include in your required submission of remediation.

 

Follow all rounding instructions per problem. If none are given, there is no rounding necessary.

assignments.name: Randomized 5th Trimester Dosage Quiz
assignments.description: Questions in this quiz are pulled from random question banks. However, the following types of problems should be expected:  Basic Math, Infusion Rate, Drip Rate, Reconstitution, Pediatric and Pediatric Weight-Based, and Adult Weight-Based.

assignments.name: 20-Question Basic Math
assignments.description:
The basic math questions are for more novice nursing students (students in 2nd trimester [Pharm, Foundations, Mental Health] or 3rd trimester [AH1/OB]). 

Expected difficulty level:  4/10

assignments.name: Fun - Time with Advance Rate Questions
assignments.description:
These questions are considered "advanced rate" questions.  Most have the aspect of asking for completion time, or time in minutes/hours that it will take an infusion to finish.  Typically, these start to appear on exams during AH2/Peds, but can populate earlier even!

Reach out with any questions!

-Prof D

assignments.name: Peer Introductions Discussion
assignments.description:
Instructions

Access the Class Introduction discussion forum and introduce yourself to your peers.

In your introduction, please include the healthcare environment you work in (if applicable) or in which one you would like to work.  The reason for taking this course.  What is your major? What year are you in the program?  What are you expecting to learn from this course?  How did you learn about AdventHealth University?  Which campus do you attend, Orlando or Denver? And please, share with us which food(s) is/are your favorite and which one(s) you dislike.  

In order to get the discussion flowing, post your initial response as early as you can, and then be sure to revisit the discussion thread to answer questions and/or enhance your learning. assignments.name: M1 Discussion
assignments.description:
Instructions

As part of your reading and lectures this week, you focused on gaining an overview of nutrition and the impact of our diets on health.  Your answers must be in complete sentences, university level. 

The discussion is worth 15 points.  Also, the peer introductions are part of the discussion for this week (+5 points). There are 3 learning objectives under section 1.4 page 13 in your textbook.  At the end of your discussion include references in APA style.  

Based on your textbook:

1. Define 'healthy diet'. 3 pts

2. Define variety and mention at least 2 reasons why variety is important. 4 pts

3. Explain what a balanced diet means. 3 pts

4. Define moderation and share with your class how does your personal typical diet stack up in terms of variety and moderation.? 3 pts

5. 1st post by Thursday: 2 pts.  (If your original post is after Thursday, those 2 points are deducted).  

6. Do not answer all the questions in one paragraph.  For each answer include its respective question.  Organization, and neatness in your discussions are important.  

In order to get the discussion flowing, post your initial response as early as you can, and then be sure to revisit the discussion thread to answer questions and/or enhance your learning. As a minimum requirement, respond substantively with at least one original comment by Thursday at 11:55 pm ET and respond to at least two of your classmates by Sunday at 11:55 pm ET. Points are deducted if there are no responses to classmates (please avoid that).  All postings, responses, and dialogue must be completed no later than Sunday, 11:55 pm.

assignments.name: M2 Discussion
assignments.description:
Instructions

Your reading and lectures this week focused on Guidelines for A Healthy Diet including the Dietary Guidelines 2020-2025, food labels, and MyPlate.

Part 1 Reading Scenarios

Read the scenario below and write/post an original response with a minimum of 200 words. In support of your response, include information from the textbook and the lectures in your explanation (in your own words). Answer in complete sentences (university level). 

  1. Frieda is trying to improve her diet. She decides to start with the Dietary Guidelines recommendation to increase her intake of fruits and vegetables so she takes a look at MyPlate for 2000 kcal/day which is the average amount of calories she needs to maintain her current weight. Based on the MyPlate recommendations in Figures 2.11 and 2.12 of your book; (2 pts)
    • How many cups of fruit and how many cups of vegetables should she eat each day? 
    • What is the equivalent amount of total cups of fruits and vegetables she needs to eat per day? For example: Per MyPlate, she needs three cups of dairy per day.  The equivalent could be 1 cup (8 oz of low-fat milk), 1 cup of yogurt, and 1 1/2 ounces of natural cheese per day. 
  2. Frieda likes fruits and vegetables but they always seem to go bad in her refrigerator and decided to buy vegetable chips. Look at the label under 'Thinking it Through' box on page 45: A case study on Using Food Labels to Guide Food Choices. 
    • Based on the label (3 pts)
    • what is the 'serving size' of those chips and how many servings this package will provide?  
    • What are the total calories per serving and for the whole package? (Show calculation)
    • If she eats the whole package, what percentage of her calorie needs would this provide? Show calculation (total calories from chips/total calorie needs per day * 100). 
  3. Although the vegetable chips are convenient, Frieda wonders if she could meet her needs with fewer calories if she ate whole foods. She decides to have whole fruits and vegetables for dinner. Visit 'myfitnesspal' database' to look for the nutrients in 1 cup of raw strawberries and 1 cup of cooked broccoli.
    • What is the caloric and fiber content of the strawberries and broccoli?  Which one provides more calorie, 1 oz vegetable chips or 1 cup of cooked broccoli? (2 pts)
    • What is the daily recommendation for fiber for an adult woman? What is the typical intake? What does it tell you? See page 107. (1 pt)
    • Which choice (vegetable chips vs. fresh fruits or cooked broccoli) do you think will be more filling? And why? (1 pt)
    • Mention 3 advantages of eating whole fruits or vegetables vs. vegetable chips. (3 pts)
    • Describe the nutrient density concept.  How does this concept relate to her choices? (2 pts)
  4. Mention the 4 Key Recommendations (Guidelines) of the Dietary Guidelines for Americans, 2020 - 2025 found in Table 2.1 (4 pts) 
  5. 1st post by Thursday: (2 pts)
  6. Do NOT answer all the questions in one paragraph.  Include all the questions with your answers. Organization, and neatness in your discussions are essential.  

In order to get the discussion flowing, post your initial response as early as you can, and then be sure to revisit the discussion thread to answer questions and/or enhance your learning. As a minimum requirement, respond in a substantive manner with at least one original comment by Thursday at 11:55 pm ET and respond to at least two of your classmates by Sunday at 11:55 pm ET. All postings, responses, and dialogue must be completed no later than Sunday, 11:55 pm.

Posting Instructions

      • Click Reply on the post you are replying to in order to respond to your classmates. You will not be able to view your classmates' posts to reply until you have posted your discussion response.
      • Type your response in the Message box.
      • Click Post Reply.

assignments.name: M3 Discussion
assignments.description:
Instructions

Critical thinking Discussion question (remember to answer in complete sentences).

1. Lydia is a college student who frequently complains of constipation.  Her typical breakfast is Coffee, white toast, scrambled eggs with cheese, and orange juice.

  • Looking at her usual breakfast, explain why her usual breakfast intake may be contributing to her constipation. (1 pt)
  • What foods would you encourage her to include in her breakfast that could help alleviate her constipation? Mention at least 2 foods. (1 pt) See pages 71 and 72.

2.  A 50-year-old man is taking a medication that reduces his saliva.  What effect might this have on his nutrients and dental health? p 58 (2 pts)

3. John has GERD and he is overweight.  His typical food intake is coffee with donuts for breakfast.  Hamburger with fries and regular soda for lunch, and snacks on chips and salsa when he gets home,  Supper is a steak, mashed potatoes with lots of butter, and green beans.  Another glass of regular caffeinated soda and a bowl of ice cream. He eats late at night and right away goes to bed. 

        A. What types of foods he is currently eating that should be limited in his diet in order to minimize GERD symptoms and why? p 70 - 71 and watch the GERD video (2 points)

        B. What other lifestyle practices does he need to avoid to treat his GERD? (2 pts)

        C. What is the difference between GERD and Heartburn? (1 pt)

4. Mary who has been diagnosed with celiac disease has difficulty absorbing the protein particle of certain cereals called "gluten".  To answer the questions please refer to p. 68-70 in your book and watch the video 'Celiac Disease; Emphasis on Diet/Nutrition'. 

          A. Please explain in detail what Celiac Disease is. (2 pts)

          B. Please explain the Medical Nutrition Therapy for Celiac Disease.  Include in your answer what specific cereals people with Celiac Disease need to eliminate from their diet and which cereals they can consume because they don't have gluten. (3 pts) 

          C. Mary usually eats Shredded wheat cold cereal with milk and a banana for breakfast.  She feels bloated each time after consuming it. What substitute cold cereal would you recommend Mary to eat that doesn't have gluten? p 68 - 70 (1 pts)

          D. Some people are eating a gluten-free diet even without a diagnosis of Celiac Disease or gluten sensitivity, What you will recommend to these people? Do you recommend continuing this practice?  Why or why not? Any personal experience? Read Debate on p. 70 (2 pts)

5. What is the difference between Probiotics and Prebiotics? (1 pt)

6. 1st post by Thursday: (2 pts)

7. Do not answer all the questions in one paragraph.  For each answer include its respective question. Organization and neatness in your discussions are important.  

 

In order to get the discussion flowing, post your initial response as early as you can, and then be sure to revisit the discussion thread to answer questions and/or enhance your learning. As a minimum requirement, respond in a substantive manner with at least one original comment by Thursday at 11:55 pm ET and respond to at least two of your classmates by Sunday at 11:55 pm ET. assignments.name: M4 Discussion
assignments.description:
Instructions

Your readings and lectures for this week focused on carbohydrates (CHO) in Health and Disease.
Case Scenario # 1
Trina is a young professional lady who is busy and tends to grab whatever is quick and easy to eat. She just read an article that says Americans make unhealthy carbohydrate choices. To evaluate her carbohydrate intake, Trina analyzes a typical day's diet using Cronometer software.
  • For breakfast, she has a big bowl of pre-sweetened ready-to-eat cereal with milk, a muffin, and a piece of fresh fruit.
  • Lunch consists of chips with salsa and a soda
  • Dinner is a big beef burrito with fries. She always drinks milk with dinner. She has another soda at night while studying. Her Cronometer analysis shows that she eats 2799 calories, 60 g of protein, 132 g of fat, 385 g of carbohydrate, 12 g of fiber per day, and 140 gms of added sugar.
  1. What is her current dietary fiber intake and what her recommended daily fiber intake should be? (1 pt)
  2. Please add high-fiber foods or substitutes to meet her fiber recommendations. For each food that you add or substitute you need to tell me the serving size, the specific grams of fiber provided in the serving, and the reference (where did you find that information). You could use Cronometer or MyfitnessPal database. ( 2 pts)
  3. What is the recommended amount of added sugars per day per the Dietary Guidelines for Americans (DGA)? What is the recommended amount of added sugars per day per the American Heart Association? 
  4. What is the percentage of added sugar in her current diet? (Multiply grams of added sugar x 4 kcal/gm and divide by 2799 and x by 100 to find the percentage). How does her intake compare with the DGA and the AHA recommendation for added sugars? Compare and explain. (2 pts)
  5. If Trina replaces the two-20-oz sodas she drinks per day with water, how many calories and how many grams of added sugar will this eliminate from her diet? You can use Coke as a reference soda.  (1 pt)

Case Scenario # 2

Watch https://nutritionfacts.org/video/the-five-to-one-fiber-rule   

Answer

  1. What diseases can be decreased or controlled with an adequate intake of fiber? (1 pt)
  2. What are the most common sources of fiber in our diet? (1 pt)
  3. Define the five-to-one fiber rule. (1 pt)

Case Scenario # 3

People who are diagnosed with Diabetes Mellitus (DM) have high glucose levels.

Please refer to pages 99-102 and to the following websites to learn more about this condition:

https://www.webmd.com/diabetes/diet-type-1-diabetes 

https://www.webmd.com/diabetes/type-2-diabetes

https://www.diabetes.org.uk/diabetes-the-basics/differences-between-type-1-and-type-2-diabetes

https://youtu.be/bIhy-Rb2xp4

1. Mention and define the 3 types of DM discussed in your book. (3 pts)

2. What is the most common type of DM? Include in your answer the major symptoms of this disease. (2 pts)

3. What are the dietary management recommendations for DM type 1? Specified recommendations for carbs, fats, protein, weight, and medication (1.5 pts)

4. What are the dietary management recommendations for DM type 2? Specified recommendations for carbs, fats, protein, weight, and medication (1.5 pts)

5. 1st post by Thursday: (2 pts)

6. Do not answer all the questions in one paragraph. Include all the questions with your answers. Organization, and neatness in your discussions are essential.  

Part 1b: Read and Respond to the other students’ postings.  Select two of your peers’ entries and write a response to each posting. Where is there agreement between your posting and your peers' posting? Where is there disagreement or difference? Identify particular strengths in your peers' postings. Your evaluation should improve your colleagues’ plans by adding points that they did not think of and/or pointing out principles in the textbook. 

Part 1c: Respond to Peer Comments. Read the comments and questions from your colleagues. Respond to comments and questions from your colleagues. All postings, responses, and dialogue must be completed no later than Sunday, 11:55 pm. See course schedule for due dates.

In order to get the discussion flowing, post your initial response as early as you can, and then be sure to revisit the discussion thread to answer questions and/or enhance your learning. assignments.name: M5 Discussion
assignments.description:
Introduction:

This week you read about Chapter 5: Lipids: Fats, Phospholipids, and Sterols

Consider the question below and write/post an original response to the module in the Discussion Forum for this module.  In support of your response, include information from your text and other research-based information about Therapeutic Lifestyle Changes for cardiovascular diseases. (see this link: Your Guide to Lowering Your Cholesterol with TLC )

The connection between the overconsumption of fats, especially saturated and trans fats, and chronic diseases (obesity, diabetes, cancer, and cardiovascular disease) underscore the importance of being alert to a client’s fat intake.

A. TLC MNT

      • Go to the link and answer the following questions:  
        1. What is the percentage of saturated fats recommendations? (2 pts);
        2. Mention at least 2  foods that your client eats that have saturated fats. (2 pts)
        3. What is the recommendation for trans fat? (1 pt.)
        4. What is the recommendation for total cholesterol intake? (1 pt.) 
        5. What is the impact of eating limited (very little) fruits, vegetables, and whole grains?  (2 pts)
        6. What is the recommendation for total fiber intake for men and women? (1 pt.)
        7. What is the recommendation for soluble fiber.? (1 pt.)
        8. Which type of fiber is the most beneficial to reduce cholesterol blood levels and why?  (1 pt.)

B. What advice would you offer a client with a history of cardiovascular disease about each of his dietary choices below? Based your answers on the link above and your textbook.

  1. Eats two or more 6-ounce servings of meat each day. 1 pt
  2. Drinks whole milk and eats regular cheddar cheese each day. 2 pts
  3. Eats four to five servings of refined breads and cereals each day including a bagel with cream cheese for breakfast, a bologna sandwich on white bread for lunch, and biscuits or cornbread with butter to accompany dinner. 1 pt
  4. Eats one serving of fruit each day and eats vegetables only on occasion. 1 pt

C. Omega 3 Fatty Acids

  1. Mention why Omega-3 fatty acids are important (their benefits) and mention 5 dietary sources. (2 pts)

D. 1st post by Thursday: 2 pts. 

E. Do not answer all the questions in one paragraph.  Include all questions with your answers. Organization and neatness are essential.   

F. Read the other students’ postings. Select two of your peers’ entries and write a response to each posting.  Include:

    • Where is there agreement between your posting and your peers’ posting?
    • Where are there disagreements or differences?
    • Identify particular strengths in their postings.

Your evaluation should improve your colleagues’ plans by adding points that they did not think of and/or pointing out principles in the textbook. Your response to each discussion posting should be a minimum of 150 words.

Respond to Peer Comments

  • Respond to comments and questions from your colleagues.

assignments.name: M6 Discussion
assignments.description:
Introduction:

The focus of your readings this week examined how eating adequate protein is important but avoiding excess protein intake as well because is related to an increased risk for chronic diseases.

Make sure your advice is evidence-based, read chapter 6 specifically the dangers of high protein diets on pages 160-161, and also look at chapter 10 to see if there are different protein recommendations for the athlete.

 

Part 1a:

Considering the health effects of excess dietary protein, what advice would you have for a college athlete who tells you he wants to bulk up his muscles and reports the following information about his food intake:

  • He eats large servings of meat (usually 10 oz of red meat) at least twice a day.
  • He drinks whole milk 2-3 times a day.
  • Eats eggs and bacon for breakfast almost every day.
  • He avoids bread, cereals, and pasta to save room for protein-rich foods.
  • He eats a piece of fruit occasionally and seldom eats vegetables.
  • He is 6 feet tall and weighs 180 lbs.  (180/2.2  to convert pounds to kg. )=  81.8 kg (~ 82 kg)

 

  1.  What advice would you give him regarding his protein intake and what food suggestions would you give him about his overall diet and why? Base your recommendations on evidence-based information that is found in your textbook, or professional journal that is not advertising products (with citation). 4 pts
  2. A. What is the RDA protein recommendation (g per Kg per day) for a regular healthy person?  B. What would be his daily protein requirement if he weren't an athlete? (Multiply his weight in kg by RDA recommendation) 1 pt.
  3. What is the protein recommendation per kilogram for an athlete? (g per kg per day).  What is his protein recommendation as an athlete? 1 pt. 
  4. What plant foods are rich in plant protein? 1.5 pts
  5. Explain in detail the concept of Complimentary Proteins. p 166-167 + Lectures 2.5  pts
  6. What recommendations you will give to the college student if he wants to substitute some of his choices with plant-based protein?  For example what type of milk substitute you will recommend to him, etc.?  2 pts.
  7. Mention 4 benefits the plant-based diets bring. p.168 -169 + Vegetarian Nutrition lecture 4 pts
  8. B12, vitamin D, and iron can be at risk for the person who follows a vegan diet.  What plant sources are rich in these nutrients? Be specific for each nutrient. p. 169-171 + Vegetarian Nutrition lecture 2 pts
  9. 1st post by Thursday: 2 pts
  10. Do not answer all the questions in one paragraph.  Include all the questions with your answers. Organization, and neatness in your discussions are essential.  

Please remember to base your answer on your Chapter 6 + Vegetarian Diets presentation.

Part 1b: Respond

  1. Read the other student's postings.
  2. Select two of your peers’ entries and write a response to each posting.
    • Where is there agreement between your posting and your peers’ posting?
    • Where are there disagreements or differences?
    • Identify particular strengths in their postings.

Part 1c: Respond to Peer Comments

  • Read the comments and questions you received from your colleagues.
  • Respond to comments and questions from your colleagues.

In order to get the discussion flowing, post your initial response as early as you can, and then be sure to revisit the discussion thread to answer questions and/or enhance your learning. assignments.name: M7 Discussion
assignments.description:
Introduction

Your readings and lectures this week focused on vitamins.

Part 1a:

In support of your response, include information from your textbook and the lectures in your explanation.

 

 

Consider which vitamins might be lacking in the diet of a client who reports the following:

  • Dislikes leafy greens and green vegetables, never eats or drinks milk or any milk products or milk substitutes, follows a very low-fat diet, and eats a fruit or vegetable only once a day.

Look at Table 7.2 pages 183 to 185

  1. What vitamins are found in leafy green vegetables and green vegetables? (mention at least 4 nutrients) look at table 7.2 pages 183 to 185. 2 pts
  2. What vitamins are found in dairy products? (mention at least 3)  1.5 pts
  3. Mention the functions of the vitamins you mentioned in the above questions (1 & 2). Mention at least 7 vitamins. 7 pts
  4. How might a vitamin deficiency weaken a client's resistance to disease? p 182 2 pts
  5. How a very low-fat diet may affect certain vitamins absorption (include the names of the fat-soluble vitamins)? 2 pts
  6. Mention 3 specific alternate foods that he can incorporate into his diet that will increase some of the vitamins that he is lacking. Make sure you mention what vitamin that specific food provides.  2.5  pts
  7. The above client has kidney problems, what is the Macro-nutrient that he needs to monitor to maintain a good function of the kidney?  p. 160-161 1 pt

assignments.name: M8 Discussion
assignments.description:
Instructions

Introduction

In your readings this week, you learned about water, minerals, and hypertension.  Make sure to use critical thinking, answer in complete sentences, and provide the rationale behind your answers. 

Part A: 

Pull together information from Chapter 1 about the different food groups and the significant sources of minerals shown or discussed in this chapter.

  1. What does DASH stand for? Describe the DASH diet and the minerals it emphasizes. What chronic disease might a patient have that would benefit from following the DASH diet? (Make sure you describe the principles of the DASH diet and why helps in regulating the body's blood pressure in your own words.) 5 pts
  2. Define hypertension and mention why is hypertension called "the silent killer"? 2 pts
  3. Which types of foods contribute the most sodium to the American diet? 3 pts
  4. The American diet is high in sodium and low in potassium; therefore, the mineral we need to pay special attention to is potassium.  What are the recommendations for potassium and sodium for the general population? 2 pts. 
  5. What are the recommendations for sodium intake for people with hypertension? 2 pts
  6. What happens when too little calcium is consumed? 2 pts
  7. What happens when too much calcium is consumed? 2 pts
  8. 1st post by Thursday: 2 pts
  9. Do not answer all the questions in one paragraph.  For each answer include its respective question. Organization, and neatness in your discussions are important.  

Part B: Respond

  1. Read the other students' postings.
  2. Select two of your peers’ entries and write a response to each posting.
    • Where is there agreement between your posting and your peers’ posting?
    • Where is there disagreement or differences?
    • Identify particular strengths in their postings.

Your evaluation should improve your colleagues’ plans by adding points that they did not think of and/or pointing out principles in the textbook. Your response to each discussion posting should include a minimum of 150 words.

assignments.name: M9 Discussion
assignments.description:
Instructions

Introduction

In your readings and lectures this week, your focus is on weight management.  Make sure you answer in complete sentences, explaining the rationale behind your answers.  

Part A:

    1. According to your textbook, list habits that do not support maintaining or achieving a healthy weight. (1 pt)
    2. Make a list of habits you have that do not support and that support maintaining or achieving a healthy weight. For example, do you skip breakfast, and then eat fast food or vending machine food? etc.  What changes would you like to make in your daily habits to improve your health and nutrition and what habits do you want to maintain? (2 pts)

       

    3. Lety gained 19 pounds in her first year of college, she was wondering why.  She now weighs 163 lbs and is 5'4" tall. Look at page 280, Fig. 9.5, and determine her BMI. Then answer: (3 pts)

      • What is her BMI?
      • In what BMI category does she currently fall?
      • For her height, what would be the maximum weight range for her to fall within normal weight/BMI?  (Do not answer the first number you see in the table, pay attention to the table and use critical thinking). 
    4. What is/are the limitation(s) of using BMI as a weight measure? (2 pts)
    5. What is the difference between subcutaneous fat and Visceral fat (include in your answer the health implications of both)? (2 pts)

       

    6. Two of the most popular diets for weight loss include the Paleo Diet and the Keto diet. Choose one, then research that diet, and explain the major points. Also, evaluate the diet you chose based on page 299 Table 9.2, and determine how you would rate this diet: as a healthy diet or a fad diet. (4 pts).

      Besides your textbook, use the following links to learn more about these diets:   https://www.hsph.harvard.edu/nutritionsource/healthy-weight/diet-reviews/paleo-diet/Links to an external site.  and  https://www.hsph.harvard.edu/nutritionsource/healthy-weight/diet-reviews/ketogenic-diet/Links to an external site.

    7. What factors contribute to eating disorders? Discuss how body ideals and the media affect the incidence of eating disorders. (2 pts)
    8. State at least two strategies to prevent individuals from developing eating disorders. Read pages 303-310.  (2 pts) 
    9. 1st post by Thursday: 2 pts
    10. Do not answer all the questions in one paragraph.  Include all the questions with your answers.  Organization and neatness are essential in your discussions.   

Part B: Respond

      1. Read the other students’ postings in your Facilitator Group.
      2. Select two of your peers’ entries and write a response to each posting.
        • Where is there agreement between your posting and your peers’ posting?
        • Where are there disagreement or differences?
        • Identify particular strengths in their postings.

Your evaluation should improve your colleagues’ plans by adding points that they did not think of and/or pointing out principles in the textbook. Your response to each discussion posting should include a minimum of 150 words.

assignments.name: M10 Discussion
assignments.description:
Instructions

Introduction

Part A:

Read the scenario below and write/post your response to the Discussion Forum for this module. Your posting should include a minimum of 200 words. In support of your response, include information from your text and the lectures in your explanations.

  • Mrs. Jones is a 26-year-old woman who is four months pregnant. This is her first pregnancy, and she is eager to learn how to feed herself during pregnancy as well as her infant after birth.  She is 5 feet 3 inches tall and currently weighs 150 lbs.  Her pre-pregnancy weight was 148 lbs.  She is very concerned about weight gain.  

    1. Calculate her pre-pregnancy BMI by going to pages 279 - 280.  Include in your answer her pre-pregnancy BMI and the maximum healthy pre-pregnancy weight in pounds for Mrs. Jones' height. (the healthy weight BMI is between 18.5 to 24.9 kg/m2 ) (2 pts)
    2. According to her pre-pregnancy BMI, do you think Mrs. Jones's weight at the start of her pregnancy was appropriate for her height? Why or why not? (was her BMI considered normal, overweight, or obese?) (2 pts)
    3. What advice should you give Mrs. Jones about her weight gain during pregnancy? Based on her pre-pregnancy BMI; what is the recommended total weight gain for her in pounds? (2 pts) (See pages 354 - 355 and figure 11.4b) 

Nutritional Needs during Pregnancy

    1. What are the recommended additional calories amount for the 1st trimester, 2nd trimester, and 3rd trimester for a pregnant woman? (2 pts)
    2. According to MyPlate Plan recommendations, her pre-pregnancy needs are based on a 2000 kilocalorie plan per day, the second and third trimesters recommendations are based on a 2400 kcal plan per day average.  She could add 100 extra calories for the third trimester but MyPlate doesn't have a 2500 kcal plan. Visit the MyPlate website or look in your textbook and find the amount of each food group she should eat for each plan (for the 2000 kcal plan and the 2400 kcal plan) and list it in your answer (the amount of grains, fruits, etc).  What would you tell her about the portions she needs to increase in the food groups in her second and third trimesters? (2 pts)
    3. Calculate Mrs. Jones's pre-pregnancy RDA recommendation for protein (show calculation), then tell me how many additional grams of protein Mrs. Jones needs during her second and third trimesters. (2 pts) 
    4. What are the specific vitamins and minerals of concern for the pregnant woman and why? Discuss the ones that are darkened in the book under 'Vitamins and Mineral Needs' section in your textbook. There are a total of 7 nutrients. Pages 360 - 362 (4 pts)
    5. Discuss the need for dietary supplements during pregnancy.  pg 362 - 363 (1 pt)
    6. How does gestational diabetes in a mother affect the baby? pg 101 (1 pt)
    7. 1st post by Thursday: 2 pts
    8. Do not answer all the questions in one paragraph.  For each answer include its respective question.  Organization, and neatness in your discussions are important.  

Part B

  2. Select two of your peers’ entries and write a response to each posting.

assignments.name: M12 Discussion
assignments.description:
Instructions

Introduction

Your lecture and reading this week addressed nutrition for childhood, adolescence, and Older Adults.

Part I:

Read the scenarios below and write/post your response. Your posting should be a minimum of 200 words. In support of your response, include information from your text and the lectures in your explanations.

Consider the different factors in children's and adolescents' history that can affect their nutrition status.

Describe what steps you would take to remedy potential problems for the following clients:

I. A 2-1/2 years old, is healthy, though slightly underweight, and headstrong. His mother hovers over him at every meal and insists that he take several bites of every food on his plate, even if he dislikes the food or is not familiar with it. Even though he is hungry when he sits down to a meal, his mother's constant urging to get him to eat quickly quells any interest he had in eating. After begging and pleading, his mothers become angry and sends him away from the table. He is not allowed to snack between meals because his mother is concerned that snacks will ruin his appetite.  He drinks about 10 ounces of 100% juice almost daily.

  1. Mention 3 factors that might be contributing to his refusal to eat.  What advice would you offer to his mom to help her improve mealtimes with her son? Read pages 391-394. (3 pts)
  2. His mother is concerned about her son's underweight; what strategies would you suggest to help him gain weight with nutritious foods? (2 pts)
  3. What is the recommendation for meals and snacks?  (1 pt)
  4. What is the recommended amount of juice per day for him? pg 392 (1 pt)

II. A 15-year-old boy who enjoys watching television and playing computer games in her spare time. He typically buys a cola and bag of chips from the vending machine for lunch and then stops by a fast-food restaurant after school for chicken nuggets or a hamburger with French fries. He has noticed that he has gained weight and lacks energy. He has a BMI of 25.

  1. Mention at least 3 nutrients he might be having in excess and 3 nutrients she may be lacking in his current diet plan.  (3 pts)
  2. Based on the growth chart provided on page 388; figure 12.3.  With a BMI of 25, what percentile does he fall into?  (Plot his age and BMI and find out approximately where he falls into) is he overweight, obese, or normal weight? (1.5 pts)
  3. What dietary advice would you offer to help him look and feel healthier?  p. 399 - 400 (1.5 pts)
  4. Why are iron, calcium, and vitamin D so important during adolescence? Explain. (1.5 pts)
  5. What would you tell him to motivate him to become physically active? (1 pt)

 

III. Joe is a widow who uses excessive medications and sometimes doesn't have enough money to pay for electricity since he needs the money for his medications. He feels lonely since his wife died and he has Type 2 diabetes, hypertension, and a lack of appetite.

The textbook refers to a checklist to determine signs of being at risk of malnutrition. Which warning signs are present in Joe and explain? See p. 409, Table 12.3. (3 pts)

D. 1st post by Thursday: 1.5 pts

E. Do not answer all the questions in one paragraph.  Include all questions with your answers. 

 

 

 

Part II: Respond

  1. Read the other students’ postings.
  2. Select two of your peers’ entries and write a response to each posting.
    • Where is there agreement between your posting and your peers’ posting?
    • Where is there disagreement or differences?
    • Identify particular strengths in their postings.

Your evaluation should improve your colleagues’ plans by adding points that they did not think of and/or pointing out principles in the textbook. Your response to each discussion posting should be a minimum of 150 words.

assignments.name: M11 Discussion Lactation
assignments.description:
Instructions

Introduction

Read the scenario below and write/post your response to the Discussion Forum for this module.

Maya has a healthy 1-month-old girl who is exclusively breastfeeding.  Mayas wants to lose weight and decided to be on a strict diet while lactating.

  1. What it is the expected average weight change for a lactating woman starting 1 month after birth? (1 pt)
  2. What is the recommendation for women regarding rapid weight loss during lactation and why? (1 pt)
  3. What are the recommended additional calories for women who are lactating an infant from birth to 6 months and from 6 - 12 months? (1 pt)
  4. What is the best indicator that the infant is getting appropriate nutrition? (1 pts) p. 373
  5. What is the recommendation for the mother to avoid dehydration during lactation? (1 pt)
  6. Mention 2 benefits of breastfeeding for the mother and 2 benefits for the infant. (4 pts) p. 376, 378
  7. Mention the difference between colostrum and mature milk (include in your answer nutritional differences) (3 pts)
  8. In the event that you become a parent, how will you feel about breastfeeding? If you are already a parent, what has been your experience with breastfeeding? Explain your answer. (4 pts) 
  9. When is formula feeding better? pg 377.  (2 pts)
  10. 1st post by Thursday: 2 pts
  11. Do not answer all the questions in one paragraph.  Include all the questions with your answers.  Organization and neatness are essential in your discussions.

Assignment Guidelines

Instructions

a. Blue zones; Want to live to 100?  Want to Live to 100? Dan Buettner Tells You How | Amanpour and Company

b. Norah O'Donnell goes "Person to Person" with Dan Buettner://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rXm_Hj2agak 

2. Watch the above interviews and write a one-page report (400 - 500 words) on what the movies were about, how it applies to your life, and your reaction to the movie.  Include in your report the actual blue zone places and the 4 pillars of every longevity DIET. Use the "Movie Review Format" found under 'Course Materials.'

Note: One paper for both interviews (NO two different papers).  The interviews complement each other.

assignments.description:
Assignment Guidelines

Instructions

Medical Nutrition Therapy (MNT) and Diseases (20 pts.)

1. Describe the TLC diet? What stands for? What specific nutrient recommendations specify?  For example; saturated fats, cholesterol, and monounsaturated recommendations, and more. Who can benefit from this diet? (5 pts) Check the link below for your answers.

https://www.webmd.com/cholesterol-management/tlc-diet#3

2. Describe the DASH diet? What stands for?  What specific nutrient recommendations does this diet promote? Who can benefit from this diet? (5 pts)

3. Mention and define one of the eating plans for people who want to lose weight. (refer to chapter 9) How much calorie deficit is needed to lose 1 pound of fat on average? (3 pts.)

4. What are the nutrition recommendations for people with diabetes Type 1 & 2? (see page 101 in chapter 4 under managing blood glucose, you can also see:  (4 pts)

https://diabetes.org/

https://www.webmd.com/diabetes/diet-type-1-diabetes 

https://www.webmd.com/diabetes/type-2-diabetes

https://www.diabetes.org.uk/diabetes-the-basics/differences-between-type-1-and-type-2-diabetes

assignments.name: What's the Issue? Assignment Dropbox
assignments.description:
For this assignment you will find an advertisement of your choice (i.e., billboard, commercial, magazine, radio, or tv) that you believe addresses a specific issue (or crises) according to Erik Erikson’s stages of psycho-social development. You will make a short (10-minute maximum) presentation in class. For this presentation you will:

  • (a) share with the class the advertisement you found,
  • (b) engage the class in a short discussion on which issue (or crises) the advertisement is addressing and why, and then
  • (c) conclude with your own answer and explanation.

assignments.name: Timelines Assignment Dropbox
assignments.description:
You will create pictorially (drawing or using your own pictures!) two timelines—one for the past and one for the future. Remember, you can draw this on paper and scan or photograph your timeline and upload that. You can also create a power point or create a website online and attach the link. Be sure to include a short description below your images so we know what this milestone was! 

NOTE: Please protect your own privacy here. There is no need to put down anything embarrassing or anything so private that you would prefer to keep to yourself. 

Timelines:

  1. For the first timeline (the past) you will select 7 milestones with a year for the date, unless you actually know the day as well. 
  2. For the second timeline (the future) you will create 7 anticipated milestones (what you're hoping to accomplish) no dates are necessary.
  3. For both timelines you will then organize each milestone pictorially (i.e., drawing, personal pictures or stock photographs found online, etc.).
  4. The timelines (past and future) will be evaluated on clarity of timeline and creativity in the creation of a timeline.
  5. See the partial sample timeline I uploaded under the folder entitled "Samples" under Modules

Identification of Course Concepts:

On your past timeline, select three milestones and connect them to concepts from the textbook. For instance, if you identified obtaining your driver’s license as a milestone, then connect it a concept we learned when we studied the adolescent period. This can be a sentence at the bottom of your slide, or however else you’d like to mark these connections. No citation necessary.

assignments.name: Timeline Class Presentation
assignments.description: Your presentation in class in comprised of 5 milestones or anticipatory goals, or a mix of both of those. This is NOT a dropbox for your class presentation, because I didn't want people to think they had to upload a power point presentation. Remember, while the presentation is mandatory--how you present is not. If you wanted to show a hand drawn timeline for your presentation, you can.

assignments.name: Portfolio Assignment 1: Developmental Period Choice
assignments.description:
In the textbook, on pages 6-7, Table 1 outlines the eight periods of human development. You have a choice of seven (sorry, the prenatal period is off the table!)

  • Infancy and Toddlerhood (birth to age 3)
  • Early Childhood (ages 3-6)
  • Middle Childhood (ages 6-11)
  • Adolescence (ages 11-20)
  • Emerging and Young Adulthood (ages 20-40)
  • Middle Adulthood (ages 40-65)
  • Late Adulthood (over age 65)

You must identify a developmental stage that you would like to study for the term and explain why. There is no word requirement. Be sure to answer the following questions:

  1. Identify which developmental period appeals to you and identify why you're interested in learning more about this group (remember, you need to pick a period where you have someone you can interview)
  2. State which developmental period you're in (remember, you cannot select your own developmental period to study!). 

If you upload a file, no title page is necessary. However, you must write in complete sentences with correct grammar.

assignments.name: Portfolio Assignment 2: Period Identification Facts
assignments.description:
It's always a good idea to understand what we're hoping to accomplish before we set out to interview an adult or engage a child in activities. To help us prepare for our interview, you must first identify and describe a minimum of 5 facts about the developmental period you selected. It's important to note that you may have selected a developmental period that we haven't covered as yet. That's ok! Use the textbook to go ahead and scan the chapter of the period you've selected and/or use the internet to help you identify facts about this developmental period. Even if you're a little ahead of our own lectures/discussions, it's ok! Remember however, to correctly reference whatever you find for your facts!

Here is an example if you selected birth to 3 years of age:

Papalia and Martorell (2015) identified attachment as developing during this period.  Attachment for this age group is broken down into three types: "(a) secure attachment, (b) avoidant attachment, and (c) ambivalent attachment" (p. 172). 

Why is it important to identify a few facts about the period you selected? Because in our next assignment you will create questions based on the facts you've identified! Make sense?

While this paper doesn't need to have a title page, you still need to include a reference page. Therefore if you're using resources outside of the textbook, keep track of them! In addition, make sure that this assignment is:

  1. All facts referenced correctly in APA format (see above example for one way to reference and be sure to include all references on a separate page!)
  2. Typed in Times New Roman font
  3. Double spaced 
  4. Written using complete sentences

assignments.name: Portfolio Assignment 3 end of class: Q&A for Interview
assignments.description:
Now it's time to put together what you've been learning and create your own questions and/or activities for the upcoming interview! Based on the facts you identified in the previous assignment, you will need to think about and develop a minimum of 5 questions and/or activities that connect to those questions. Keep in mind the following guidelines if you interviewed:

  • An adult: If you selected an adolescent or adult period to interview, your questions may be fairly straight forward. Develop your questions based on the facts you identified and get ready to ask them! Remember, you must create at minimum 5 questions. Four of those questions may be direct questions but 1 must be a type of activity!

Here's a tip: Keep your question open-ended!

      • An open-ended question will give you more information. An example would be, "how would you describe your childhood?"
      • An example of a closed-ended question would be, "Was your childhood nice?" Any question that can be answered with a single word is a closed-ended question.

 

  • A child: If you have selected a child you will need to have the caregiver in the room and discuss with the caregiver beforehand what you would like to do. Keep in mind that depending on the age group you've selected asking direct questions may be more challenging. For instance, if you select a child, asking if they have developed conservation isn't going to work. Therefore, you will need to engage the child in activities. So think of activities related to the facts you discovered that you could safely and reasonably do. If you are interviewing a child, you will need to create 4 activities to do with the child, and at least one question for the caregiver.   

Here's an example if you selected the early childhood period (ages 3-6):

Fact #1--Children in this developmental period have not learned conservation as yet (Papalia & Martorell, 2015). Therefore, the first activity will be to test if the child has learned conservation or not. I will pour the same amount of water in two clear (i.e., plastic or nonbreakable glass) cups and ask the child if the water is the same or different between the two cups. Once the child agrees that the water is the same between the two, I will pour one cup into a taller, thinner cup and then ask the same question. According to the textbook, if the child has failed to understand conversation, he or she should report that the water in the taller, thinner cup is more and not the same. 

These questions and/or activities must be:

  • typed in Times New Roman, 12 point font
  • double spaced

assignments.name: Complete Portfolio with Interview and Reflection
assignments.description:
Now we add our interview and reflection and put everything together in one complete (APA correct) paper!

Check out the sample paper I uploaded so you can see what I mean. Below are instructions for putting your Developmental Portfolio together.

Interview:

Now that you have conducted your interview, it's time to write it up!

For this part of this assignment you were to select someone that you knew who is in the age group you initially selected and interview them. This is where you used the questions and/or activities you created earlier in the term. I would like for this portion of the assignment to mean something to you, so feel free to ask other questions as they come up! See if you can see the psychological concepts we discussed come alive! 

Now that the interview is done, you'll need to write a minimum of one page double spaced paper explaining what questions you asked with a summary of their answers and/or a description of their behavior if you engaged them in activities. Keep in mind that I'm not looking for a verbatim transcript of the interview. 

Be sure to have the interviewee sign the waiver form 

Reflection:

This reflection should be a minimum of one page double spaced. You just completed a course in Developmental Psychology and had the opportunity to observe a specific age period. What stood out to you about the assignment? Anything? Did you learn anything new either about the person you interviewed or this developmental stage? If you did this assignment over again, what would you have done differently? If nothing stood out to you from the whole portfolio, then what stood out to you about the course? What do you think you’ll take with you as you move forward in your career? Or, how does what you learned influence you now?

Upload one complete final project:

Now you will put everything together in one complete paper. This includes all the pieces we've been working on throughout the term: (1) your period choice, (2) your facts, (3) interview questions, (4) interview results and waiver and, (6) your reflection.

Please see sample paper for an example. Please also see the rubric below, the newest parts of this assignment have higher points assigned, the summary of your interview as well as your overall reflection.

assignments.name: Reading Viewing Report
assignments.description:
Students may select a book (from the reading list under Library Resources, Selected Readings tab) or they can select a movie or television series of their choice, and write a 2-page reflection on how the themes in the book, movie, or television series can be applied to one of the four units.

While a brief summary of the story should be included, it should not be the entire paper. This assignment should be written in APA format, double spaced, Times New Roman Font with a title page and reference page. The rubric can be found in Canvas within the Modules Folders.

Please note: If a student chooses a movie or television series, they must supply via email to the professor, their rationale for their choice, and what potential themes they see applying to one of the four units discussed in class.

Additionally, if a student selects a television series, in order to gain approval for the assignment they must select (at minimum) and identify three specific episodes in email to the professor, along with the potential connections they are teasing out of the episodes to one of the four units discussed in class.

 

Assignment Rationale: You will learn that one of your greatest resources as a healthcare provider is yourself—your personality, your interests, experiences, and strengths. This assignment gives you the opportunity to begin applying your specific interests to the key themes in the courses.

assignments.name: Drop box Interviewee Waiver and Confidentiality Agreement

assignments.name: Collaborative Writing Project
assignments.description:
It's now time to upload your final document as a group!

As a group you will be turning in one 3-page (minimum) paper (typed in APA format which includes a title page, reference page, double spaced and 12-point Times New Roman font), that has identified the themes (minimum of 2) you all found across your interviews!

To earn full credit for this assignment you must discuss how many interviews were conducted, what questions were developed to be asked, how your group identified themes across all the interviews, and what the themes were. Think about your process--were there some themes that didn't fit? Were there themes that really jumped out at the group? I would like you to explain your process in the paper. Lastly, you'll need to include what stood out to each of the group members about the process of collaborative writing and what you learned about groups and working as teams. You can see the rubric below for further information. 

 

Assignment Rationale: This assignment helps us remember that healthcare is a collaborative effort. In some fields like Nursing there is something called Team Nursing! Therefore, for this service-learning assignment, you will be seeing healthcare through the eyes of a practitioner or patient and working together as a team to connect the themes that you found.

assignments.name: Journal 5 Reflection

Class Attendance

Under special circumstances, absences from class may be made in advance with the course instructor’s approval. In case of an emergency, notification of the course instructors must be made as soon as possible. Hi Students, 

Here's what I'm asking you to do:

Pick a time to meet with me to learn the expectations of this course and have your questions answered. 

Here's why I'm asking you to do it:

This meeting will help you know how to be successful in this class. You will leave feeling confident that you know how to navigate this class, know what is expected of you, and have your questions answered. This is a mandatory meeting as outlined in the Welcome. 

Here are the times available for the Course Expectations Meet-up: Monday, Jan 13, 6:00 pm-7:00 pm ET; Tuesday, Jan 14, 11:00 am-Noon ET; or Wednesday, Jan 15, 8:00 pm-9:00 pm ET.  Please note that ALL TIMES are for the Eastern Time Zone.

Here's how to do it:

You must sign up in the 2 PLACES described below:

1. Click the link below and sign up:

Sign up for the Course Expectations Meeting

2. Enter your name under the day and time you want to meet. 

3. Enter the day and time you want to meet in this dropbox as well. (You get to the dropbox by clicking the blue "Start Assignment" button in the top right corner of this page, then choose "text entry," write your chosen day and time there, and submit it!)

assignments.name: Self-Care Interviews
assignments.description:
Here's what I am asking you to do:

  • Watch the video interviews above.
  • Answer the questions below.

Here's why I am asking you to do it:

When "being there" for others, we also have to make sure we take care of ourselves so that we don't run dry. The four people interviewed have experience with grief in the workplace, and each has a unique perspective and helpful suggestions to share. 

In Week 14, we will have a lecture on Self-Care and another assignment on it.  However, since your Recollection of Death and Loss paper is due this week, I wanted you to start thinking about self-care.  Sometimes thinking about the losses we've experienced in life affects us emotionally in negative ways.  While it's always okay to feel sad about the losses we've experienced, after some time has passed, we don't want the negative emotions to cripple us from living our life.  Self-care can help us cope with the grief in adaptive ways instead of maladaptive ones. 

If you feel like you need any extra support as you work on writing your Recollection paper, please do not hesitate to contact your section instructor or lead instructor.

Here's how to do it:

Name one point from each of the four people interviewed that was interesting to you and explain why.  (Number each answer and make sure to reference the speaker.)

assignments.name: LECTURE: Living Means Losing & Discussion Posts
assignments.description:
Dear Students,

Welcome to your first lecture! We are excited to begin this journey with you. This lecture is presented by Prof. Alicia Patterson, the professor who developed this course.

Here's what I am asking you to do:

  • Watch the video lecture above and pay attention to the 3 questions that are asked. Please post your answer to Question #1 on the discussion board, respond to 2 classmates, and be ready for a quiz on the whole lecture. 
  • Always watch lectures to the end. There will be random checks tied to attendance.
  • Note: Please use the Chrome browser to watch videos if you have a Mac.

Here's why I am asking you to do it:

It’s easy to correlate grief only with death—but many kinds of loss can cause us to grieve. While our class will deal mostly with the grief of death, this lecture explores other losses that deserve to be grieved. These are called "ambiguous losses." Understanding this concept and grieving those losses will increase emotional health and help us respond compassionately to grief in our patients' lives that we might not otherwise have seen.

All 3 of your posts (your initial post and your 2 response posts) should be posted by Sunday, 11:59 pm ET (initial post = 10 pts., and response posts = 2.5 pts. each).

(Hint: Get these posts done and out of the way early in the week. It will work better if you don't wait until Sunday!)

assignments.name: LECTURE: Being There & Discussion Posts
assignments.description:
Dear Students,

Most people don't know how to support someone who is grieving. They feel awkward and afraid of saying the wrong thing.  This lecture is an interview between lead instructor Dr. Marla Nedelcu and section instructor Chaplain David Labrador, and it will address this topic.

Here's what I am asking you to do:

  • Watch the video lecture above. It contains a discussion question; please post your answer to the discussion board and respond to 2 classmates. 
  • Always watch lectures to the end.  There will be random checks tied to attendance.
  • Note: Please use the Chrome browser to watch Panopto videos.  (Especially with a Mac.) 

Here's why I am asking you to do it:

We know how to congratulate someone for graduating, celebrate them when they get married, and rejoice over a new baby ... but when a person dies?  We so often say nothing.  One of the problems is that we don’t teach anyone about how to respond to this most normal and predictable experience in life - death.

We don't know what to do.  We are worried about saying the wrong thing - and so sometimes we don't "show up" for the bereaved at all.  ("Bereaved" is the term for someone who is grieving.  It has its roots in an Old English word that means to "rob" or "deprive.")  This video will help you know what to do.

 

All 3 of your posts (your initial post and your 2 response posts) should be posted by Sunday, 11:59 pm ET (initial post = 10 pts. and response posts = 2.5 pts. each).

(Hint: Get these posts done and out of the way early in the week.  It will work better if you don't wait until Sunday!)

  • Be insightful and show that you watched the video thoroughly. 
  • Fully and comprehensively answer the question in 2 minutes or more.

For your two classmate responses, you must WRITE your responses:

  • Use correct grammar, spelling, and punctuation in your responses. (Not "text" talk!)
  • Be at least 75 words each. (Not long, but thorough.)
